4:25.race_name: Celebrate At Hawke Barn Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: A Definite Getaway
runners.comment: 2-6 over fences and he chased home a big improver at Doncaster latest; major player
runners.spotlight: 2-6 since switched to chasing in the summer, the wins gained on good ground at Worcester (2m4f) and Exeter (3m); well-held second at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) when last seen in December but that was behind a big improver and he's the standout contender in this line-up on his return.

stable_tour.quote: His form has actually turned out quite well and he's been a proper, consistent horse. He won at Exeter in October and was second at Doncaster last time out behind The Kniphand. He doesn't like it soft but I'm sure he'll win his fair share later this year. 26-03-25

runners.name: Up The Straight
runners.comment: On much-reduced mark and could be dangerous if he can revive on this drop back in grade
runners.spotlight: Returned from a lengthy absence with pulled-up efforts over hurdles (2m4f, good to soft) and fences (3m, good) but his last run was in a Class 3 handicap at Kempton last month and he's been dropped another 6lb since; could be dangerous if he can revive on this drop back in grade.

quotes.race: Chris Young Memorial "National Hunt" EBF Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Up The Straight is a horse I was so excited about at home that I was afraid to say anything about it as generally they make a fool of you. But I think it's one of those races where one went flat out, a couple tried to go with him, and we've benefited from being ridden more quietly - Richard Rowe, trainer.

runners.name: Castle Daragh
runners.comment: Pulled up in last four starts and needs a big turnaround in new headgear
runners.spotlight: Won a hunter chase at Chepstow (2m7f, good) last April on rules debut but he's been pulled up in four runs since including in two chase handicaps this year; potentially on a useful mark but he needs a big turnaround in new headgear.

runners.name: Imperial Storm
runners.comment: Failed to complete in both chase starts and needs a transformation with headgear added
runners.spotlight: Badly out of form over hurdles this season and has failed to complete since switched to chasing for last two starts; didn't jump with much fluency before being pulled over C&D last time and he needs a transformation with headgear added.

5:00.race_name: Totnes And Bridgetown Races Company Ltd Open Hunters' Chase
5:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Assassins Lullaby
runners.comment: Record of 2-27 in points and is probably best watched on this belated rules debut
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-27 in points and he's had some ups and downs in that sphere in 2025; now makes his belated rules debut and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Kings Quay
runners.comment: 2-15 in points but he won his only start under rules and that was over C&D; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won a hunter chase over C&D (good) on rules debut in April 2023; held in just three starts back in points since but his last run in February was after a long absence and he's not ruled out on this return to regulation fences.

runners.name: Sam Barton
runners.breeder: H R H The Princess Royal

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Pulled up in three of four points this year; last of five finishers at Kempton yesterday
runners.spotlight: Became very disappointing under rules for Emma Lavelle last season and he's been pulled up in three of his four points this year; finished remote at Kempton on Tuesday.

quotes.race: Sporting Life EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was confident even though we hit the front too soon, which I couldn't do much about as Sam Barton took me there. He's a fine horse, who's still a big baby, and he'll make a lovely chaser - Adam Wedge, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We thought he'd be a smashing chaser last season but it didn't happen. A slow maturer, he was a different animal when winning at Worcester two weeks ago. He jumped with confidence and battled. He doesn't want conditions too slow and should stay well. 02-11-22

He won his maiden hurdle last season at Doncaster but we plan to go chasing with him this year. His schooling last week was very good and I plan to start him off this Saturday at Ascot in a novice handicap chase over 2m4f. He has been crying out for fences and as he has strengthened up now is the right time and I expect him to do well. 26-10-21

runners.name: Snap Fish
runners.comment: Lightly raced 6yo who has won two points and needs checking in market on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Ended last year with two easy wins in points (3m, good to firm/good) but was turned over at odds-on in that sphere last month; not easy to weigh up now switched to rules but he's still lightly raced and needs a close look in the market.

runners.name: Switch Hitter
runners.comment: Very useful in prime and has won points in last three starts; big player back under rules
runners.spotlight: Very useful over fences in his prime for Paul Nicholls; last rules win was over two years ago but he's won points in his last three starts including a comfortable success (3m, good to firm) ten days ago; looks a major player now back in this sphere and yard won this in 2023 and 2024.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Christchurch Handicap Chase (For The Harry Dufosee Memorial Cup)
quotes.quote: I ride Switch Hitter every day and he's a tough horse to get fit. He was meant to run at Chepstow in October, but had a setback and then ran at Cheltenham last time. It's taken him a while to hit form, but he has at home in the last ten days. Small-field races suit him and Bryony got him jumping in a rhythm and said he had a bit left in the tank. I'm sure Paul will find a race for him in the next month or so and he handles good ground. He's got ability and hopefully this is the start of him - Conor Houlihan, pupil assistant.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm really chuffed. Switch Hitter was very steppy over his hurdles and had a really bad fall at Kempton, and we've had to do a lot of work at home with him. He was absolutely brilliant here, once he'd jumped the first I knew he was going to be good - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Silver Plate Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's job done for Switch Hitter. He could go to Sandown on the last day of the season for a two-and-a-half-mile handicap hurdle if the ground is quick, then we could look at a novice chase back here at Kempton in May - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Wise Betting At racingtv.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When I spoke to Paul this morning he said 'make all, make sure it's a good gallop'. His inexperience showed a little bit so there's more improvement to come and Switch Hitter kept finding all the time so he'll definitely stay. He was brave and kept me in the race when I needed him to. A few more starts will tell us more about how good a race it was, but as a jockey it rode like a nice race and he's got some improvement given he was babyish - Bryony Frost, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won a couple of novice hurdles at Kempton last season and makes his debut over fences in a novice handicap chase at Hereford on Tuesday. He'll make a good, fun, staying novice chaser. 08-11-21

runners.name: Windance
runners.comment: Fairly useful chaser at his best but hard to know how much ability remains; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful staying chaser at his best but last win was two years ago and things have not gone well in a hunter chase and two points this year; bit to prove and hard to know how much ability remains.

quotes.race: GBIM Women Investors Network Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I was worried when the fizz seemed to go out of Windance with a circuit to go, but he's obviously got a gear he can keep going at. Every time a fence came, he gained a length and it was a great ride. Hopefully he can go on and keep creeping away. I didn't think we'd be running because the ground looked set to be quick and he has had a tendon, which is why he's had a big gap in his career - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his last two chases and jumps great. He looks to handle most ground and I think he'll still be competitive off his current mark. There should be more to come and he's a straightforward horse. 12-10-23

3:55.race_name: Become An Exeter Racecourse Annual Member Handicap Hurdle
3:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Inside Man
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant
runners.comment: 2-6 over hurdles and had excuse on heavy last time; dangerous back on much faster ground
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-5 over hurdles with a comfortable win in small-field novice here (2m, good) in November; well held back in a handicap at Leicester (1m7f) last time but he took a strong hold with a hood added and may not have handled the heavy ground; headgear is now removed and he could kick on again on this return to much quicker conditions.

quotes.race: DragonBet Oncourse Service Online Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inside Man can be a bit busy and needs to learn to settle, switch off and come with a run, which he did here. He's a Manatee and they tend to want soft ground. He's a chaser in the long term - Jane Williams, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: Making the running wouldn't have suited him at Taunton last time but he was still able to win. He's shown plenty in two starts, having only just been beaten by Liari on his debut at Wincanton. The Triumph trial at Cheltenham this month is a possibility for him. He'd learn nothing in another junior or juvenile hurdle under a penalty, whereas if he goes up in grade he will be running against proper horses and a good gallop, which would suit him. 11-01-24

runners.name: Seeyouinmydreams
runners.comment: Headstrong mare; 2-4 over hurdles and she looks interesting back in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Headstrong mare, with a mixed record in four runs over hurdles; well-held third of four at Kempton (2m5f) when last seen in October but that was after emphatic wins in a Worcester novice (2m) and Fakenham maiden (2m4f); still has untapped potential in this sphere and she looks interesting back at this trip on handicap debut; all four wins have been on good ground including in a point and bumper.

quotes.race: Visit Irish Store Sales With ITM Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Seeyouinmydreams is a fair horse and she'll go to Aintree now for the mares' bumper there. Harry had never sat on her, but said he thought she'd win going to the start because she felt so good. We haven't pushed many buttons and we thought she was nice, but you never know until you run them. She's already won a point-to-point, so will be a lovely hurdler next season after a summer of strengthening - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely prospect and I've been delighted with her, but we're in it for the long game with fillies like her and I'm in no rush. She was very impressive when hacking up by 15 lengths in a Irish mares' maiden point-to-point at Largy in April, after which she was bought at the Tattersalls May NH Sale. She didn't come cheap but all the right faces were trying to buy her. She's from a great family, being related to three winners, notably the smart hurdler Songe. Two or three runs in bumpers will suffice for this season, but without doubt she's a name to remember for the future. 31-10-22

runners.name: Tarahumara
runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than for last win but he needs a major revival on comeback
runners.spotlight: Won from the front in his first two handicap hurdles (both 2m; good and soft ground) but was pulled up in next two starts and he struggled again at Newton Abbot (ninth of 11) in his final run last summer; now only 1lb higher than for last win but he needs a major revival after 301 days off.

stable_tour.quote: He only had two runs last season and bled on his chase debut at Uttoxeter where he clearly wasn't right. I was delighted with his win at Warwick on his comeback and I liked the way he lengthened away in the straight. The handicapper didn't miss him and put him up 8lb but he's a big horse who could go back over fences at some stage. At the moment we'll stick to hurdles and two miles. We've always rated him highly and, now that he's healthy, it's time to see just how nice a horse he might be. 22-11-23

runners.name: Campaign Trail
runners.comment: Unexposed hurdler but has bit to prove after a heavy defeat last time; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Triple Flat winner, who won on his hurdle/stable debut at Doncaster (2m, good) in November but he struggled when switched to a handicap at Taunton in February; still unexposed in this sphere but has bit to prove after that last run and others are preferred; cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We bought Campaign Trail at the sales last year and he had a hairline fracture on his pelvis literally the first day we schooled him, so we gave him the whole year off. Willie Mullins said to me at the time if he was his, then he'd be out in the field, although he did actually end up that way because we couldn't train him. They've [Its Only Money ownership group] been incredibly patient. It's a big investment and they've got something to look forward to - Kim Bailey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's an exciting young horse who had a good record on the Flat. He's ready to run over hurdles after a setback last year. He's done everything we've asked of him and I'm really looking forward to seeing him out. 19-11-24

runners.name: Princess T

prev_owners.owner: Harte Investments Ltd And Dajam Ltd
Harte Investments Ltd And Dajam Ltd

runners.comment: Seven-time hurdle winner who scored at Wincanton on penultimate run; respected on return
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is ideally suited by good or quicker ground; best known for her exploits in Jersey but she scored at Wincanton (1m7f) on October and ran to a similar level when a creditable third at Hereford the following month; remains feasibly treated on old form and she's respected on her return.

runners.name: Commanding View
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner but he returns to this sphere after another break and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Recorded his second hurdling win when scoring at Bangor (2m, good) last May but he's been well held in two runs over fences since; now returns to this sphere but he's still 3lb higher than for last win and has bit to prove after another break.

stable_tour.quote: He's a proper terrier and a bumptious character. He's not very big but his stable name at home is ‘Naughty' because affectionately he's like that by nature. However, he just keeps battling and trying in his races. He was fifth at Taunton over 2m last week and our doubt was that the ground was slightly on the softer side and that he had 12st, which wasn't ideal for a small horse. He's a nice horse for novice handicap chases and there's lots to like about him. 16-01-25

3:25.race_name: Exeter Racecourse Christmas Parties On Sale Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
3:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Broderick
runners.comment: Newcastle winner who still has potential over hurdles; respected on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won a Newcastle maiden (2m1f, good to soft) in January and was creditable second at Doncaster (extended 2m3f, good) next time; beaten 15l when runner-up in small-field novice at Sedgefield last month but that was behind a useful prospect and he still has potential in this sphere; respected with cheekpieces added on handicap debut.

runners.name: Espoir Des Forges
runners.comment: Disappointing in his last two runs and has something to prove on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Started his hurdling career with two promising placed efforts at Warwick (2m3f, good) last spring but his form has nosedived in two subsequent runs; now returns to quicker ground but he has something to prove and this is competitive on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's in very rude health. He had entries earlier this month but sadly couldn't go anywhere because of the weather. He ran for us in November when we had our dip in form and definitely was one of them who didn't finish his race off. He's a different horse now and is doing everything really nicely at home. We'd be very confident he'll carry on improving. 16-01-25

runners.name: Koukeo
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo but he was pulled up at Ayr last time and needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: All of his six runs have been on slow ground; second in a Chepstow bumper in October and filled the same position in first two runs (2m1f/2m) over hurdles; ran well for a long way when sixth of 15 on handicap debut at Musselburgh (1m7f) in February but he was pulled up at Ayr last month and has something to prove after that laboured effort.

stable_tour.quote: It was probably all a bit too much for him going over to Punchestown for his first outing in April, but he'd shown some nice pieces of work before finishing second at Chepstow last month. He'll be going over hurdles now and we're keen to get some experience into him. He could be a nice stayer down the line. 06-11-24

runners.name: Super Saint
runners.breeder: Mrs G M Thoumas & Mrs A M Bouysse
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Sedgefield and he's open to more progress; respected
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on handicap debut when justifying favouritism in five-runner race at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) last month; up 3lb but that was a comfortable win and this well-related 6yo is open to more progress; respected.

runners.name: Al Sayah
runners.comment: 2-2 in handicaps over hurdles and she needs a close look back in this sphere after a break
runners.spotlight: After two wins over hurdles (2m3f, good) last spring she bounded clear for an 8l success on the Flat at Bath (2m1f, good to soft) June; held in final two runs last year but she's 2-2 in handicaps over hurdles and could find more progress back in this sphere after a break; needs close look.

2:55.race_name: Haldon Gold Cup Returns In November Novices' Handicap Chase
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Rangatira Jack
runners.owner: Mrs D Robinson Mrs & Mrs Livesey-Van Dorst
runners.comment: 12-race maiden but he was a close second in a C&D handicap last time; big player
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden but he's not had many chances over fences and was beaten less than 2l when runner-up in C&D handicap (good) last month; back up 2lb in the weights but he pulled clear of the third last time and is a big player if he can back that up.

runners.name: Wot You Wearing
runners.comment: Out of sorts over hurdles of late and was tailed off on chase debut last month
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner but he's been out of form in that discipline of late and was tailed off on chase debut at Chepstow (2m7f, good) last month; continues to drop down the weights but he he has lots to prove.

runners.name: Ici La Reine
runners.comment: Two bumper wins but he's generally struggled over hurdles; plenty to prove on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Two bumper wins for previous yard but she's generally struggled in six hurdle runs and was last of ten in a Southwell handicap (2m, good to soft) last month; dropped another 5lb but has plenty to prove back up in trip on chase debut.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 EBF Mares' NH Flat Race (Cat 1 Elim') (Cond' & Amateur Jockeys) (GBB) (AW)
quotes.quote: I thought Ici La Reine would run a bit greener than that, but Dylan (Kitts) gave her a lovely ride and he is a brilliant claimer who is a big part of the team. She'll improve markedly on the back of that - Warren Greatrex, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's related to La Bague Au Roi, who was a superstar for us. She won two bumpers but didn't handle the occasion at Aintree on Grand National day in the big mares' bumper and also got a bump. She ran a really encouraging race at Market Rasen over hurdles last month and that form looks solid, so I think she'll be winning soon and will keep improving. She'll get three miles and be a proper chaser one day but it'll be two and a half for the moment. 13-12-23

runners.name: Constant Friday
runners.comment: 10yo who is still unexposed over fences but he needs a major revival
runners.spotlight: Hasn't achieved much at all since returning from a long absence and the return to good ground made no difference when last to finish at Fontwell (2m2f, good) two weeks ago; still unexposed over fences but he's in the veteran stage now and others are preferred.

runners.name: Moonlight Artist
runners.owner: The Cheltenham & South West Racing Club
runners.comment: Unexposed chaser who is on a dangerous mark and needs a close look after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-10 over hurdles but his win was off 13lb higher at this track (2m7f); pulled up in first two chase starts and was only sixth of ten at Taunton (2m3f, soft) last time but he's had wind surgery since and needs a close look back from a short break; tongue-tie added.

stable_tour.quote: He was in training all of last season and ready to run but we didn't want to risk him on the ground. He'll go novice hurdling in the middle of November but works nicely. He seems like a nice horse. 31-10-22

runners.name: Blue Ribbon
runners.comment: Overall record of 1-21 and was always behind on recent comeback at Taunton
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner but he's 0-9 over fences and was always behind at Taunton (2m, good), on his recent comeback after a year off; cheekpieces now return but others are more convincing.

runners.name: Miss Marette
runners.comment: Had another wind op but has plenty to prove on her return
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably with cheekpieces added back over fences here (2m1f, good to soft) in October but she refused to race next time and was tailed off at Taunton in final run last year; had another wind op since but she makes little appeal on her return.

runners.name: Hi Riko
runners.breeder: S C E A De La Chaussee
runners.comment: 17-race maiden who was pulled over hurdles latest; opposable
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden with form figures of P5P over fences and he was pulled up over hurdles in his final run during the winter; opposable back in this sphere after a short break.

2:25.race_name: Book Haldon Gold Cup Hospitality Novices' Selling Hurdle
2:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Land Afar
runners.owner: This Horse Is For Sale Partnership
runners.comment: Disappointing latest but that was on heavy and he's a major player if he can bounce back
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 10yo; disappointing in small-field novice at Leicester last time but that was in the mud and he sets a fair standard on some earlier form, including a second at Huntingdon (2m4f) in January and a win in a Ludlow claimer (2m, good to soft) in December; major player if he can bounce back and his bumper win was on good ground.

quotes.race: Jennings Meats (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Land Afar was a wee bit keen at Cork and the ground was bad that day. I was a little concerned about running him today because he's such a big horse and I was wondering would he let himself down on the ground, but he did and won well - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Kintaro
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden under both codes and has lots to find on these terms
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden under both codes; wasn't beaten far when fourth in a Taunton handicap (2m3f, good) last month but that was off a lowly mark and he has lots to find on these terms; can only be watched.

runners.name: Saddlers Dream
runners.comment: Tailed off in both bumpers and same story at massive prices in two hurdle runs last month
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in both bumpers and same story at massive prices in two hurdle runs last month; cheekpieces are now added on this step back up in trip.

runners.name: Denzil
runners.comment: Stratford winner who still has potential and he's respected dropped into a seller
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Stratford (2m, soft) on debut in October; 0-5 since but he's finished runner-up twice and his latest third in a Warwick handicap was behind a major improver who made all; still has potential for top yard and he's respected dropped into a seller.

runners.name: Breccia
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner but she's 0-5 over hurdles and needs plenty of progress back at this trip
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins (2m) on the Flat but he's 0-5 over hurdles and couldn't pose a serious threat off a basement mark at Wincanton (2m4f, good) last Monday; that was after a break but she needs plenty of improvement on this drop back in trip.

3:37.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap
3:37.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Spartan Arrow
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Got up late to win on AW three weeks ago; 2lb rise not insurmountable; still low mileage
runners.spotlight: Promising on turf for the Crisfords as a 3yo and he ran a fine race when third at the Dante meeting (5f, good) on his only run in 2024; well beaten on his stable debut at Newcastle in February (after 280 days off) but back on the up when rewarding market support at Wolverhampton three weeks ago, keeping on strongly to lead close home; 2lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run and drying ground is a bonus.

runners.name: Paddys Day
runners.comment: In blistering form on AW this year & ran well in one C&D start; up in weights; claims
runners.spotlight: Reliable for some time but things have really clicked this year and he comes here chasing a five-timer after four 5f wins at Newcastle; climbed up the weights as a result but he ran well on his only visit to Musselburgh last April (second to one who ended the year rated 24lb higher); one to take seriously in current form.

stable_tour.quote: A winner at Windsor on his debut, he's come out of that race really well and is an uncomplicated horse who should be suited by six furlongs at Ascot. It won't be easy but he's always gone very well and takes everything in his stride. 09-06-22

runners.name: Looking For Lynda
runners.comment: 0-12 last year but ran some fine races in stronger handicaps than this; considered
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in 2024 but he ran numerous good races in defeat and begins this campaign off a dangerous mark; improved for his reappearance effort last year but possible the heavy ground that day wouldn't have suited; considered.

runners.name: Curious Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: 5f win at Redcar (soft) last October; will need to be at his best after a 146-day break
runners.spotlight: Promising 2yo; he had dropped in the weights prior to making all in a 5f Class 4 handicap at Redcar last October (soft ground; off 2lb lower); unplaced twice after and now returns from 146 days on the sidelines.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Glorious Gallop Gala Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: William (Pyle) said Curious River took him there and did it easily. He's won a couple of races now and seems to be getting quicker - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Dave Watson Memorial/EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C & D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Curious Rover is a nice horse. He didn't show as much speed as that when we first got him so we started him off over a bit further but he's probably a right sprinter. He's learned his job nicely and progressed each time so it's perfect. We'll probably look for something under a penalty now, he's going to get a stiff enough mark - Katie Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very fast gelding who won twice as a two-year-old and this season ran an absolute cracker when fifth in the 3YO Dash at Epsom on Derby day behind Blue Storm, proving that he has trained on. He was just a bit lost for a few seconds in the dip and lost momentum. Without that he could have been third, but it was still a huge run and he now goes to Chester at the end of the month - he'll take some stopping provided he gets a good draw. 14-06-24

runners.name: Profitable Edge
runners.comment: C&D winner who goes well fresh; could improve further as a 5yo
runners.spotlight: One of her two wins last year came over C&D; absent since finishing fourth at York's Dante meeting; doesn't look handicapped out of things and she has run on her seasonal return in both years since joining the Barrons; contender.

runners.name: Thankuappreciate

prev_owners.owner: Ms Sara Hattersley And Miss Tracey Mann

runners.comment: Ended 2024 in good form on AW; modest strike-rate on turf; others appeal more for the win
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 in good form on AW, winning 5f handicaps at Southwell and Chelmsford; just 1-24 on turf and could prove vulnerable for win purposes.

quotes.race: Titanium Racing Club EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Horses In Band D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. The steering wheel seemed to fall off Thankuappreicate last time and he couldn't be got under control, but he was straightforward today. I don't know what the level of that form is, but you couldn't ask for more than what he did today - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky not to win at Ayr last time. He didn't get the best of passages and had to be switched, and he couldn't quite quicken up for that level of experience. We've got to run him once more to get a handicap mark for nurseries. I'm sure he'll win races. 27-07-22

runners.name: Mon Na Slieve
runners.comment: On a lowly mark but he's been a bit disappointing since September
runners.spotlight: Should be well treated on his best form but he's not progressing, with wind and gelding operations seemingly making no difference; unplaced in races won by reopposing rivals on his last two starts; risky.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky after winning his novice first time out at York because he never really had his ground. He loves it fast and even good to soft is no good to him. He's an out-and-out 5f horse who is up to winning some nice races. 04-04-24

runners.name: Eternal Sunshine
runners.comment: Flourished last year but has a 194-day absence to contend with
runners.spotlight: Came alive last summer, winning a 6f classified event at Thirsk last June and adding four handicap wins afterwards (including C&D); absent since finishing in midfield (sent off favourite) in the Ayr Bronze Cup 194 days ago; can progress further this year but might come on for this return.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a really good season, winning five times. It was frustrating to get beat last time when she got hampered in the Ayr Bronze Cup. She's a homebred and we purposely let her mature. I still think there's improvement in her but we've decided that was enough for the season. Hopefully she'll come back off a nice mark next year and we'll look to follow in the footsteps of American Affair. 02-10-24

1:37.race_name: Virgin Bet Supporting Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
1:37.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Spartan Warrior
runners.comment: Soundly beaten here on stable debut in November but has shown some hurdling ability since
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten here (12.5f) on stable debut in November but has shown some hurdling ability in the meantime and is completely unexposed over this sort of trip on the Flat; swaps cheekpieces for first-time blinkers.

stable_tour.quote: He's the first horse we've had for Jimmy Fyffe and was rated 71 on the Flat when trained by Ollie Sangster, winning at 1m2f and 1m4f. He's schooled very well and will start in a juvenile hurdle at Musselburgh at the end of November, with a view to looking at some of the lucrative juvenile hurdles if we can. 16-10-24

runners.name: Pigeon House
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L

prev_owners.owner: J P O'Flaherty & M E Phelan & Mrs J Harrington & R Galway

runners.comment: Ran well on latest Flat start last May but not at his best over hurdles lately
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler; creditable third of 16 at Galway (1m6f, soft) on latest Flat start last spring but has not been at his best over jumps this year and would probably prefer the ground not to dry out here.

quotes.race: Specialist Group Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pigeon House is entered on the Flat at Gowran next week and he will probably mix it. He had been threatening to do that all Winter and he liked that better ground - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He was purchased in the Tattersalls online sale by the owners from Jessica Harrington's yard. He's being lined up to run on New Year's Day in the Hogmaneigh Hurdle at Musselburgh. He's rated in the 130s and he might be a bit better going right-handed. We thought that was a nice race to start him off and it would be a lovely way to start the year if he wins. 05-12-24

runners.name: Throne Hall
runners.comment: Well handicapped on form as recent as last summer but must prove his wellbeing
runners.spotlight: Regressive 8yo who returned from a break with two underwhelming hurdle runs in February; very well handicapped on Flat form as recent as last summer but his return to this code (in refitted cheekpieces) on Friday was truncated when the race was stopped and declared void, and he still needs to prove his wellbeing.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Throne Hall has been a tricky horse, he looked like he was going to be pretty good over hurdles, he beat a good horse of Nigel Twiston-Davies' at Wetherby, but he basically hasn't turned up since. He's not straightforward but the soft ground helped him today. It's great to see him back to form - Archie Watson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He looks like he should be suited by stepping up in trip. Sheikh Obaid [owner] mentioned this race straight after York and he's an exciting contender. If he does stay, he could be the one for the Ebor. 10-06-21

runners.name: Trojan Sun
runners.comment: Ended last season in good form (course winner) and remains lightly raced for his age
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in good form, winning here (2m2f, good) before two thirds off today's mark elsewhere; remains lightly raced for his age and can pose a potent threat if tuned up after six-month layoff.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Musselburgh over 2m2f in late August and has finished third the last twice- at Chester and Ayr on Tuesday. He's probably going to have another couple of runs this autumn as he seems to handle soft ground. He's a young horse who's improving. He ran on good ground at Ayr on Tuesday and it would be good if we can get another run with him on soft ground before the end of the season. I doubt we'll run him on the all-weather this winter and we'll probably wait until next year with him. 02-10-24

runners.name: Glasses Up
runners.comment: Consistent over middle-distance/staying trips last season; resumes on career-low mark
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing last over 1m in November but was consistent over middle-distance/staying trips last season; began that campaign with a good run and launches this one from a career-low mark; might be the answer.

quotes.race: CPMS Handicap
quotes.quote: I've won on Glasses Up a few times. We thought the mile might be short for him but he's proved us wrong. They went a good gallop and he picked up well - Paddy Mathers, jockey.

quotes.race: Get So Much More With Racing UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Glasses Up is just getting better and better and in time I'm sure he will step up to one and a half miles. His target is the Kilkerran Cup at the Gold Cup meeting - Mike Smith, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a super horse. When I bought him at the sales I was told I could spend £8k, maybe £10k at a push, and I rang the boys up and said, “I'm going to have to go to full budget for this.” The boys said, “Mike, that's a lot of money for a horse who hasn't run”, and I said “yes, but he's a cracking horse.” He was actually bought with an entry for the Derby. He's now won eight races for us and £121k in prize-money, so it was money well spent. The boys have turned down fairly good offers for him because they wanted to keep racing and having fun with him, which is commendable. He was a good third on his seasonal reappearance at Ayr behind Fiver Friday. He benefited from a racecourse gallop on the track after the Scottish National meeting, which is a fantastic thing and I think that's one of the reasons the Irish horses do so well. 16-05-24

4:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Mullwarchar
runners.comment: Clear promise in two of his three runs and he needs a close look on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Well held in a Southwell novice last time but he's was only beaten around 3l in first two starts including from a wide draw at Lingfield (1m, AW) in January; needs a close look now switched to a handicap and he's bred to be much better than this opening mark.

runners.name: Its Only Fun
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer who has had wind/gelding operations since last run; market informative
runners.spotlight: Mixed record in his three qualifying runs (5f-7f) last year but he looks feasibly treated on his peak effort; had wind/gelding operations since last run in October and he needs checking in market upped to this trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Princess Pw
runners.owner: Miss P Wothersoon, Michael Watt, B Crew

prev_owners.owner: Miss P Wotherspoon & Michael H Watt

runners.comment: Placed in three of her four runs and she's an interesting contender on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to a useful 1m/1m1f winner Rothko (RPR 93); finished placed in three of her four runs including when a close third under positive tactics in Chelmsford maiden (7f) in January; should be fine on the step up to this trip and she's an interesting contender on handicap debut.

runners.name: That Lucas Fella
runners.comment: Still early days but needs a transformation upped to this trip on his return; been gelded
runners.spotlight: Well held in all four runs, including at 25-1 on handicap debut at Newcastle (6f, AW) in November; been gelded and it is still early days but he needs a transformation upped to this trip on his return.

runners.name: Sovereign Class
runners.comment: Unexposed filly but she's not progressed so far and needs improvement back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when runner-up at Newcastle (1m, AW) in January but she's not gone on from that and was down the field on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f) 11 days ago; still unexposed but she needs improvement back up in trip.

3:07.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap
3:07.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Falcon Nine
runners.comment: Exposed maiden but he's on a handy mark and can build on last month's stable debut
runners.spotlight: 18-race maiden; pick of last season's efforts bring him right into the reckoning and he could build on last month's stable debut (1m, AW); well drawn if breaking on terms; more appealing than many.

runners.name: Clasina
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden but she returns from a break on a dangerous mark; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: On a handy mark on last year's best form but she ended the campaign with some quiet runs; probably wouldn't want a tactical event at the trip but Hollie Doyle a notable booking.

runners.name: Capuchinero

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park X, Simon Wood & A Haynes

runners.comment: Just one win on turf but she comes here with a feasible mark on this winter's best form
runners.spotlight: Just one win on turf, a small-field success at Brighton last summer (7f, soft); ran well at Wolverhampton in February and it was a useful race for the grade in which she was sixth last month; not discounted.

quotes.race: Book Online At dundalkstadium.com Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Capuchinero is genuine and tough. She has won two now and she is sound and tries. She is a good fun horse for the winter - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: This lovely filly was bred by Chasemore Farm and we managed to get one run into her last autumn when third in a 7f novice at Newmarket, where the form has been boosted by the fourth horse winning twice since. She is training nicely and will definitely get a mile. I hope she will prove a nice filly for owner Andrew Black and I am looking at a median auction maiden at Catterick on April 6. 30-03-22

runners.name: Without Delay
runners.comment: Three-time course winner; had a wind op since last seen; back from six months off
runners.spotlight: Three of her four wins have come at this track, all over 1m (7f winner at Catterick last summer); absent since a poor C&D run in October, after which she had wind surgery (her second such operation); first time out perhaps not the time to catch her.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well for us this season, winning twice, over a mile at Musselburgh in May and then over 7f at Catterick in June. She's also been third at Thirsk and fourth last time out at Catterick, not beaten far, behind Swinging Eddie. She's had more luck this year than last season when she was placed a lot but had a lot of bad draws. At Catterick on Monday she led but then got squeezed. She did come again but she'd had enough by that stage and finished seventh behind Vince Le Prince. 22-08-24

runners.name: Golden Valour
runners.comment: C&D win off 5lb lower last October; needs to return at the top of his game
runners.spotlight: C&D win off 5lb lower last October (good to soft); absent for 147 days and he'll need to return at the top of his game.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Golden Valour is much better than his mark. I thought he wasn't helping Donagh up the straight but it was hard work in that wind. There's a valuable handicap here next month which we might go for - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We ran him over hurdles during the winter but he's had a break since February and will be running on the Flat again soon, where he's still only rated 55. He's a nice-looking, well-bred horse. He might do a bit of both, Flat and jumps, just to sweeten him up. He's been a bit unlucky and I‘m hopeful he can improve from his current mark when he comes out. I'm looking forward to running him. 16-05-24

runners.name: Ramon Di Loria
runners.comment: Got up in the last stride to win at Wolverhampton (6f) three weeks ago; more needed up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Gained the seventh win of his career when collaring a longstanding maiden in the final stride at Wolverhampton three weeks ago; 3lb rise could be enough to scupper a follow up.

quotes.race: Foley's Bar & Off Licence Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Ramon Di Loria ran well at Dundalk. He is a good ground horse, Ronan gave him a lovely ride and I think he'll go forward from here - Tracey Collins, trainer.

runners.name: Bird Of Play
runners.comment: Yet to shine for this yard and opposable despite his reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Yet to shine for current stable and, although he's dropping down the weights, others bring more compelling claims.

runners.name: Keep Me Stable
runners.comment: Comes here on the back of three placed efforts; likely to make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: She has won on turf but better known for AW exploits; placed on her last three starts and this free-going mare can give another good account.

quotes.race: Bet £10 Get £40 At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: We put Keep Me Stable out again because she came out of her last win in great form and we wanted to give her a chance. Tommie (Jakes, jockey) was taking 7lb off and when a filly is in good form you have to run them, you don't if they're not. She did it nicely and it was great. Being at Newcastle suits her because she can run against the rail and I think she likes the straight seven furlongs - Linda Perratt, trainer.

runners.name: Impeach

prev_owners.owner: The Attwater Partnership And J Daniels

runners.comment: Down in the weights and shaped okay over 1m last week; 0-14 on turf and 0-17 over 7f+
runners.spotlight: He has run some fair races for this yard but all four wins, the latest of them in November 2023, have come over 6f on Polytrack; solid effort over 1m last week; each-way shout.

runners.name: Coconut Bay
runners.comment: Wolverhampton win in February but others bring more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but she did manage to put her head in front in a classified event at Wolverhampton in February; has C&D form but others are more appealing in this field.

runners.name: Doomsday
runners.comment: C&D win last summer but likely best watched back from six months off
runners.spotlight: Won a classified event over C&D last August; readiness for his first start in six months has to be taken on trust.

runners.name: Thunderstorm Katie
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P & J Hopper, Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden; hasn't built on a promising stable debut in three runs since
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all nine starts; ran okay on her stable debut at Newcastle (6f) last October but hasn't built on it in three runs since; others appeal more.

4:43.race_name: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap
4:43.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Fortunate Star
runners.comment: Won twice at Southwell in November; below par last time but feasibly treated back on turf
runners.spotlight: Won twice at Southwell (5f) in November; solid efforts on his next three starts but his form dipped at Southwell in January; unlikely to dominate this field but he's not handicapped out of things.

runners.name: Sergeant Mayer
runners.comment: 6f turf win last summer and ended 2024 with three runner-up finishes; absence to overcome
runners.spotlight: 6f win at Nottingham last summer; ended his 2024 with three runner-up finishes; effective over C&D but the 166-day absence is the concern.

runners.name: Beneficiary

prev_owners.owner: Al Mohamediya Racing & Mrs E Burke

runners.comment: Back to last winning mark and well drawn; had few opportunities on turf; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins in January; only seen three times on turf (all over C&D in the summer of 2023) and showed some aptitude for it; has the rail draw and the pace to hold a good early position; possibilities.

runners.name: Carmarthen
runners.comment: Hard to recommend after last week's reappearance (pulled hard and finished a remote last)
runners.spotlight: 6f AW win for Jack Channon last summer; pulled hard when a remote last of nine at Wolverhampton on last week's seasonal return; enough to prove.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Six [furlongs] is definitely Carmarthen's trip. She leaves a lot for herself, I'm not saying she's ungenuine but she's still learning and it took a horse to come to her before she could put the race to bed. She idled pretty much the whole way and, if we direct her the right way, she should be winning again  - Edward Greatrex, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jamie Bond
runners.comment: Not beaten far on AW last time; overall profile suggests he's not sure to back it up
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut in April 2023 (5f, soft) but he's gone backwards since then; did fare better when a close third at Newcastle three weeks ago but only five ran and he's not sure to build on it.

runners.name: Kyber Crystal
runners.comment: Two wins last year, including C&D; returns to action off fair mark; one for the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Won twice in the second half of 2024, including C&D; returns from 135 days off on a fair mark; can get it wrong at the start but she's not ruled out with Hollie Doyle booked.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We kept it simple and got the job done. Kyber Crystal has plenty of form on soft ground, so hopefully we should have some fun with her through the autumn - Rebecca Menzies, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Royal Duke
runners.comment: Progressive at a low level last year; still low mileage; market useful after an absence
runners.spotlight: Progressive at a low level in his first season, gaining breakthrough success over C&D in October (beat Kyber Crystal); could improve again this year but this is his first outing since November; stable also runs Ski Angel.

runners.name: Stroxx
runners.comment: Bolted up at Newcastle in January; in and out since and unlikely to be able to dominate
runners.spotlight: Ran away with a 5f classified event at Newcastle in January and backed that up with a close third in handicap company; not at his best at Wolverhampton 19 days ago, however, and he'll do well to get to the front with Mrs Bagerran in the field.

runners.name: Henery Hawk

prev_owners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Mrs D Dalby & Harrowgate Bloodstock Ltd

runners.comment: Back to form on AW the last twice; still seeking a first turf win though; others are safer
runners.spotlight: He has dropped a long way in the weights in the last 12 months and there have been more encouraging signs at Newcastle the last twice; 0-18 on turf though and others make more appeal for win purposes.

runners.name: Mrs Bagerran
runners.comment: Both wins, and most of her best form, has come over C&D; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins in 2023; not at best on AW the last twice but she returns to her favourite track off a dangerous mark; high on the list.

runners.name: Ski Angel
runners.comment: C&D winner; won on seasonal return last spring; dangerous mark; drying ground not ideal
runners.spotlight: Four 5f wins on good or slower, the latest of them over C&D last June off a 6lb higher mark; drying ground not sure to suit but she won on her seasonal return last May and can't be ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: The owners have been very patient as they bought her as a yearling. She went to John Quinn but never raced as a two-year-old. She ran three times as a three-year-old without winning and the owners brought her here along with Bloomin Robbery. She's now won three times for us, including at Ayr last time out. She's gone up 5lb for that to 53, but the way she won you'd like to think she's got a bit more in hand and I see her as a high 50s or low 60s horse. She was ridden last time by Duran Fentiman,  who rides for Tim Easterby. He's an underrated jockey - very strong and capable. 16-05-24

2:37.race_name: Livescore Bet Best Odds Daily Confined Maiden Stakes (Three Runs Or Less) (GBB Race)
2:37.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Dwindling Funds
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: Half-brother to a 6f winner out of a winning sprinter; best watched on belated debut
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 6f winner Maybe Even Never (RPR 82); dam 5f turf 2yo/6f AW winner (80); stable not renowned for winning newcomers; best watched on belated debut.

runners.name: Tee Aitch Aye
runners.comment: Only minor appeal on paper and likely one for the longer term
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to 7f AW/1m turf winner Believe Me Now (RPR 57); dam unraced half-sister to two winners; likely to come on for this initial experience.

runners.name: Masala Chai
runners.comment: Modest form in bumpers and on her Flat debut five weeks ago (7f, AW); now tried in a hood
runners.spotlight: Modest form in bumpers and on her Flat debut five weeks ago (7f, AW); now tried in a hood.

runners.name: Clouds Hill
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Closely related to useful 7f winner Fall Of Rome; has a useful standard to aim at on debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal; closely related to 7f winner Fall Of Rome (RPR 95), half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Hill Spirit; dam 7f and 1m (Listed) 2yo winner (98); appealing pedigree but he has a useful standard to aim at on debut.

runners.name: Gaelic Gladiator
runners.comment: Two runs last autumn weren't without hope; yard in form; needs a good step forward though
runners.spotlight: His two runs last autumn weren't devoid of promise and his stable is in fine form; he will need to raise his game to trouble the principals though.

runners.name: Motawaared
runners.comment: Promise in both AW runs this year and far from exposed; leading claims for Newmarket yard
runners.spotlight: Promise in both AW starts, more recently keeping on well behind one who has defied a penalty since (1m); open to further progress and he is his Newmarket trainer's only runner on the card (five runners at Musselburgh to date have recorded one win, two seconds and two thirds).

runners.name: Raulin
runners.comment: His improved third in November came on AW but he should be just as good on turf; claims
runners.spotlight: Promise on slow turf last year but he improved for the switch to AW when third at Newcastle in November (1m); gelded since; one to consider back from a break.

runners.name: Transfuse
runners.comment: Down the field in two runs (for J O'Brien on debut) last autumn; hard to recommend here
runners.spotlight: Down the field at Dundalk in one run for Joseph O'Brien and fared no better on his stable debut four weeks later; stable has a more obvious candidate in Gaelic Gladiator.

runners.name: Zowal
runners.breeder: Miss Scuderia Micolo Di Nicola Gall Et
runners.comment: Sold for 69,000euros having shown clear promise in three French runs; free-going colt
runners.spotlight: Placed in each of his three runs for J-C Rouget in France last year (7f-1m, good, very soft and heavy), showing a tendency to race freely and drift right under pressure; badly squeezed out in the final furlong at Bordeaux in November, after which he was sold for 69,000euros; going right-handed should be beneficial on his stable debut and he's one to take seriously.

2:07.race_name: Livescore Bet EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
2:07.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Round course (GoingStick 7.4)

runners.name: Ardisia
runners.comment: £33,000 half-brother to three winners; likely type on paper; one to take seriously
runners.spotlight: February foal; £33,000 yearling; fifth foal; half-brother to winners Prince Of Rome (5f AW including 2yo; RPR 92), Mia Grande (French 9.5f AW) and Exertive (Italian 1m1f/1m2f); dam placed 6f AW 2yo (62); stable doesn't send many to Musselburgh (4-18 overall and 1-2 with 2yos); likely type.

runners.name: Dandy Speed
runners.comment: 7,000euro half-brother to useful sprint winner World Of Darcy; dam 6f winner; check market
runners.spotlight: February foal; 7,000euros yearling; second foal; half-brother to Listed-placed 5f/6f winner World Of Darcy (including 2yo; RPR 90); dam 6f winner (81); Charlie Johnston just 1-22 with 2yos at this track.

runners.name: Filly Foden
runners.comment: £25,000 half-sister to 3 winners; dam useful (7f); foaled over 2 months later than rivals
runners.spotlight: April 28 foal; £25,000 yearling; sixth foal; half-sister to winners Some Skye (French 1m1f/9.5f including AW Listed; RPR 98), Vasco Da Gama (French 1m; 78) and Stirling (Belgian 7.5f/Portuguese 1m); dam Group-placed 7f winner (100); stable's Brocklesby runner performed with credit but this filly is the youngest in the field and by some way.

runners.name: Ours De Soleil
runners.owner: Heaton, G Wood, West Shaw Farm & E Burke
runners.comment: Half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Botanist (RPR 79); powerful stable; betting to guide
runners.spotlight: February foal; 3,500gns foal, 8,000gns yearling; fifth foal; half-sister to 6f AW 2yo winner Botanist (RPR 79); dam 6f 2yo winner (95); represents a powerful stable and commands respect.

3:45.race_name: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Boyne Cup (A Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Annsam
runners.comment: Not at best this season but now 5lb lower than when winning this race in 2023
runners.spotlight: Well below best form since returning from long absence this season but moves back up in trip after respectable third of four at Exeter (2m3f, good) last month and is now 5lb lower than when winning this race in 2023.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Annsam is a smashing old boy on his day. If you're being brutal about it, this ground is hard work and I'd say it stopped a lot of them behind us. I wouldn't get carried away but he's a horse who wins races wherever you go - winning trainer Evan Williams.

quotes.race: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were only going on breeding and what we were half hoping Annsam could do. I have to admit I was a bit critical of the handicapper after his victory at Ludlow. I thought we had just tootled around in a small-field race. I have to admit he was right - Evan Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I'm told Tom Segal, Pricewise of the Racing Post, is fond of him and Tom knows things before I even think about them! I'd like to get a run under Annsam's belt quietly to blow the cobwebs away as he's a big, raw, strong horse. He's in a race at Ascot on Saturday but I'm not in love with going there. That said, he'll need a run because if he's too fresh he can be very, very bullish. He lost all chance when making a terrible early mistake in the old Racing Post Chase [Coral Trophy] last season but that was because I'd left him too fresh. He could be a horse, if he progresses, for the Coral Gold Cup or Grand National. He's lovely, still young and raw, but with a bit of luck I wouldn't rule out those good races. He's definitely got the ability. 26-10-22

He did well for us last season, winning a Listed handicap chase at Ascot as well as a competitive handicap hurdle at Newbury. This season he has had two runs, the latter in the Coral Gold Cup when sixth to Le Milos. We'll revert to hurdles next week for the Lanzarote at Kempton. That'll be the ideal prep race for the valuable 3m handicap chase back there in February. We've learned with him that he's all the better if you give him a spin somewhere before his big target. 05-01-23

runners.name: Destroytheevidence
runners.comment: Has taken well to fences this season and will be suited by today's ground; major player
runners.spotlight: Began chasing career with win at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) in October, form that has worked out very well, and ran well in defeat on two of his three subsequent appearances; will be suited by the forecast good ground here and has a big role to play.

quotes.race: Carl Pyne 60th Birthday Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This is a race we like and a nice place to start off with a novice. Destroytheevidence did very well over hurdles last season and he has improved for a fence. He was bought for chasing and was impressive there - Mat Nicholls, assistant to trainer Kim Bailey.

quotes.race: Trustatrader trustatrader.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Destroytheevidence wants three miles and we put cheekpieces on him today because we needed to go quicker. We planned on Cheltenham next week, but saw the rain and he wants good ground so I didn't want to wait. He'll jump a fence. We'll go up to three miles again next time - Kim Bailey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a great start to the season. He's a lovely horse who has done us proud and it would be nice to think he could get to Cheltenham for the race Chianti Classico won last season [Ultima]. 19-11-24

runners.name: Java Point
runners.owner: N T Griffith & H M Haddock
runners.comment: Runs this track well and is still on workable mark after last month's Sandown second
runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner (twice here) who rebounded from a poor performance with a close second at Sandown (3m, good) last month and remains on a workable mark; must be considered.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Java Point has the look of a chaser in the making - he jumps very well, is straightforward and honest. He's mixed it in some good races over hurdles and deserved to get his head in front. He has all the attributes to make a very good staying chaser - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

runners.name: Good Boy Bobby
runners.comment: Ran well in Newbury veterans' chase last month but the faster ground here is not ideal
runners.spotlight: In the frame on five of six starts this season, most recently when placed in Newbury veterans' chase (3m2f, soft) last month; 2lb lower here but the faster ground is probably not ideal and younger rivals appeal more.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka Paradise Island Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 9 Of The Veterans' Chase Series)
quotes.quote: Good Boy Bobby has been with us for a very long time and that is his twelfth win for us now. We were desperate to keep him in the yard and Jayne McGivern (of Dash Grange Stud) rang and said we will have him as she has loved watching him in all of his races. He loved it out there today. We might find one more race before coming back here for the final providing everything is okay. I don't think the owners are too keen on the Grand National, but I would love to have a go - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 7 Of The Veterans' Chase Series)
quotes.quote: I thought we got racing a hellish long way out, Aye Right got tired late on and Good Boy Bobby has a great constitution. I was ready to give out that he wasn't fit enough, when you're a jockey you think about blaming everyone else but yourself. Hopefully he'll be a perfect type for these veterans' races. The final at Sandown will suit him really well - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Rowland Meyrick Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very gutsy. Good Boy Bobby stays and it was a good performance in that heavyish ground. He's very exciting. He's very progressive. I've got to talk to the owners but I hope he could be a National horse, hopefully this season. He stays and he jumps. He's not at all ground dependent - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Cash Out At bet365 Handicap Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Good Boy Bobby was very good today. Nigel and the team have done a great job over the summer. He disappointed last year. He lost his form and lost his confidence a bit. He's been big, bold and fresh since he came back. It's nice he's won a competitive pot like that first time out - Daryl Jacob, jockey.

quotes.race: Marketing Stop Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Good Boy Bobby can sometimes be his own worst enemy as he can be a bit too free, but he has got into a nice rhythm in front on his first try at this trip. I think that will probably be it for this season and he will be back in the autumn when he will go novice chasing - Jason Maguire, owners' racing manager.

quotes.race: Smarkets Novices' Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Good Boy Bobby was very good, I'm really happy. He got lit up a little bit but relaxed well in front. He jumped well and hopefully he has a big future - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider .

quotes.race: Family Fun Raceday - Sunday 29th April Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Good Boy Bobby is a decent horse, he wasn't right at Newbury. He wears earplugs and is a bit nervy so we decided to miss Cheltenham and we will now wait and go hurdling with him next season - Jason Maguire, racing manager to owners Paul and Clare Rooney.

quotes.race: Coral Best Price Guaranteed Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: We think Good Boy Bobby is potentially very good. Where we go from here is up to Dad, Jason Maguire and the owners, but we're going to have a job on our hands keeping Nigel away from the festival. He's going to be a smashing horse for hurdling next season. He's got a massive engine, it's just trying to contain it. You've seen what he can do with a penalty on heavy ground; he's made it look very easy  - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

runners.name: Straw Fan Jack
runners.comment: Commendable third at last year's Cheltenham Festival but out of form this season
runners.spotlight: Commendable third off 11lb higher at last year's Cheltenham Festival (2m4f, soft; good ground also suits) but badly out of form this season (four runs) and is the one in this line-up with by far the most to prove.

quotes.race: squareintheair.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Straw Fan Jack has done us proud. He ran in some big handicap hurdles last season, when he probably should have gone chasing, but racing in those big fields has taught him to be a racehorse and wake up. I don't know what we'll do next, but he does want the better ground. Do I think he's Arkle horse? It could be a dream - it probably had crossed my mind but I'm too modest to jinx anything. It's a dream and it would be amazing to have a horse able to run in the Arkle. Sheila Lewis, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Straw Fan Jack has been unbelievable. Richard said there wouldn't be much pace in the race so he knew we'd have to go out and make the running. He's quite lazy and needs other horses alongside him ideally but I knew he'd stay well. He's definitely my star horse, it's great to have one for Saturdays now. I have no plan really of where to go next. Richard suggested the Sandown final which he qualifies for so maybe there - Sheila Lewis, trainer.

2:45.race_name: Birthday Bonanza Mares' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Sainte Doctor
runners.comment: Good-ground C&D winner last spring and back in good form in recent weeks; good chance
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D (good) last spring and has been back in good form in recent weeks, winning at Fakenham (2m5f, good) and Stratford (2m6f, good to soft); still on a workable mark after latest 4lb rise; good chance.

quotes.race: £50,000 Queen Boudicca Series Qualifier Mares' Handicap Chase (Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's very satisfying to get Sainte Doctor back in the winner's enclosure and I've won on her a few times now. She has had her problems but we've ironed them out and that was a lovely performance - Richie McLernon, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's just come back in and will be ready to run in the summer. She's won two of her last three starts, so her form looks good. She won by 15 lengths at Plumpton last time. She's a nice mare and hopefully she can remain competitive. 06-03-24

runners.name: Regal Renaissance
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D & T Futter & Mr B Keogh
runners.comment: Largely consistent mare who ran well in defeat over C&D six weeks ago; respected
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent mare who has a good record at this track over hurdles and fences; ran well behind all-the-way winner over C&D (good to soft) six weeks ago and will be fine on today's faster ground; respected.

quotes.race: Alpha Aggregates Handicap Hurdle (For Female Amateur Jockeys)
quotes.quote: Regal Renaissance lost her front shoe last time at Sedgefield which I think unsettled her but she's still very green and novicey. I'd imagine she can keep getting better and we'll be coming back here given her owners [Ludlow Racing Partnership] - Henry Daly, trainer.

runners.name: Happy Dex
runners.breeder: S C E A De La Chaussee
runners.comment: Back from long absence with two very underwhelming runs this year; cheekpieces now added
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on some of her old Irish form and will be suited by today's trip/ground but returned from long layoff with two disappointing runs this year (2m4f/2m) and needs a big boost from the new cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Congratulating Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Happy D'Ex has been a bit disappointing and is one we were considering moving on. Jack said that the fast gallop suited her well. It was a nice performance. Maybe she can build on that and she will definitely jump a fence - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was just touched off on her first start over fences at Fairyhouse. You'd have to be happy with that as a starting point, especially as she needs further than two miles. 18-10-22

runners.name: Trapista
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De La Perelle
runners.comment: Completed hat-trick with C&D win last spring but was out of form when last seen in winter
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick when pipping Regal Renaissance over C&D (good) last May and is now 3lb below that mark but looked out of sorts when last seen in the winter and needs 69-day break to have done her good.

stable_tour.quote: I'm not sure it was a great race at Huntingdon but it was the last time she could run in a novice hurdle and she won nicely. She'll have to make the step into handicap company now and we might look at a mares' handicap hurdle at Cheltenham in December. 18-11-21

runners.name: Bond Broker
runners.breeder: C A F R E Enniskellen Campus
runners.comment: 2-2 over hurdles, making all in small field both times; limit of ability hard to gauge
runners.spotlight: Has a tendency to race too freely but won good-ground Fakenham bumper in first-time hood at end of last season and has made all in two small-field hurdles at around 2m this term (good to soft/good); we don't yet know the limit of his ability and he ought to make a bold bid here.

quotes.race: MW Paving & Groundworks Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward on Bond Broker. He's growing up all the time - Freddie Gingell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: After he'd run too free on his second outing in a bumper we fitted a hood next time and he won nicely. He goes novice hurdling from December onwards and seems particularly well suited by a sound surface. 04-11-24

runners.name: An Buachaill Rua
runners.comment: Won Irish point by 15l in February and should have a future under rules
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete first two Irish points but got his act together with 15l win in February (yielding to soft); should have a future under rules; market may point the way.

runners.name: New Man
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Des Jap & Oliver Triboir
runners.comment: Well beaten when fourth in modest Hereford novice on debut in November; not seen since
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected French hurdle winner but was well beaten when fourth in modest Hereford novice hurdle (2m, good) on debut in November and has not raced again since.

runners.name: Mister Cessna
runners.comment: Well beaten at Cheltenham last month but better judged on his C&D second two runs ago
runners.spotlight: Won slow-ground hurdle in France last spring and bettered disappointing British debut when second over C&D (good to soft) in February; well down the field in Cheltenham Festival handicap last month and remains untested on ground quicker than good to soft but still a leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: He was very disappointing first time at Chepstow. We put him in the deep end there, but I embarrassed myself and the owners with that entry. He really redeemed himself at Ludlow, and I think we'll definitely take our chance in the Boodles if he gets in. 18-2-25

runners.name: Cherryhawk
runners.comment: Out of form on Flat in the autumn and struggled (albeit on heavy ground) on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat last spring but was badly out of form in that sphere in the autumn and struggled (albeit on heavy ground) on hurdling debut at Chepstow in January.

stable_tour.quote: She's also threatening to win a race. She's a homebred half-sister to Cherry Hill. She loves the soft ground. Her conformation in front isn't brilliant and I'd never run her on quick ground. She could run on the all-weather but I'd love to find a handicap for her on soft ground before the end of the year. 21-09-23

runners.name: Farhh Echo
runners.comment: Showed some ability in autumn bumpers but improvement is needed on this hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a mare from a very good Flat family; displayed promise in two good-ground bumpers in the autumn but needs to take a big step forward to pose a threat on this hurdling debut.

runners.name: El Rayo
runners.owner: The Jack, Queen, And King Syndicate
runners.comment: Ran well in two of his three qualifying races but probably needs to improve to win this
runners.spotlight: Belied 33-1 odds when placed on hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m, good) in November and, after a lesser effort on soft ground, again showed significant promise when fifth at Market Rasen (2m4f, good) last month; almost certainly needs to improve to overcome opening handicap mark, though.

runners.name: Crac De Megaudais
runners.breeder: J D'Argentre, G D'Artentre Et Al
runners.comment: Improved form when wide-margin winner at Fakenham in January; resumes on 13lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Displayed big jolt of improvement on latest outing three months ago, keeping on strongly to win by 12l in refitted hood at Fakenham (2m4f, good; well backed); 13lb higher here and form from that idiosyncratic track does not always transfer to other venues but further progress is possible.

runners.name: Elusiveness
runners.comment: Cruised clear to win easily by 3l in first-time blinkers at Taunton last week; 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify strong market support when only fifth at Exeter (2m2f; wore cheekpieces) last month but cruised clear to win easily by 3l when returned to 3m and fitted with first-time blinkers at Taunton (good) eight days ago; should be hard to beat under 7lb penalty here.

quotes.race: Par Inn Cornwall Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's been a long time and we were beginning to wonder what we had to do to make Elusiveness win. I think the better ground and headgear helped with her jumping and probably it wasn't a very good race. I think we can build on today. She's big enough to jump a fence and there are plenty of races she could run in - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

runners.name: No Worries
runners.comment: Absent since disappointing run in November and remains on fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Four-tme hurdle winner (twice in Jersey); will be very well suited by the forecast good ground here but has been absent since a disappointing run in November and remains on a fairly tough mark.

quotes.race: JCB Mini-Excavator Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Neil thought that winning over in Jersey would have done No Worries no harm and he went through the race and jumped like a horse who was confident. It's obviously a bit more of a winnable race than the English one! It's something I can say I've done - jockey Dylan Johnston speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Tellairsue
runners.comment: Returned from long layoff with encouraging run in December but performed poorly last time
runners.spotlight: Won four-runner Fontwell handicap (3m2f, good) in spring 2023 and returned from long absence with encouraging fourth at Uttoxeter (2m4f, soft) in December but ran no race at Southwell in February and is 3lb wrong today; others look safer.

runners.name: D Day Arvalenreeva
runners.comment: Won readily by 12l on recent handicap debut at Market Rasen; carries 7lb penalty today
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who made the frame on her first two hurdling starts and was evidently well suited by switch to good ground when readily winning four-runner Market Rasen handicap (2m) by 12l a week ago; needs to be taken very seriously under 7lb penalty here.

runners.name: Lady Caro
runners.comment: Battled well for narrow win at Plumpton last month, her 11th hurdling start; up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at 11th attempt, battling well to prevail by a head at Plumpton (2m, good) last month; only 3lb higher here and ought to remain competitive.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think she wants the ground as soft as it was at Warwick on Tuesday and just weakened when you didn't want her to. She shaped like a horse with lots of ability and will come on a bundle for it. 02-11-22

runners.name: Culligran
runners.comment: Ran well when fourth on soft ground last time and conditions here ought to suit better
runners.spotlight: Yet to make any significant further progress since 7l win at Hereford (2m, good to soft) in November but her fourth at Warwick (2m, soft) in February was a pretty good effort; ought to be better suited by today's faster ground and has possibilities if the new cheekpieces have any positive effect.

runners.name: Organic
runners.comment: Triple Flat winner; safely held in three hurdle races but improvement likely in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner last year; safely held in three novice/maiden hurdles for new stable this year but open to considerable improvement in handicap hurdles and will be feared if strong in the betting.

runners.name: Sawpit Sienna
runners.breeder: D A Hunt And A T Huckfield
runners.comment: Arrives after two respectable runs and is well handicapped but younger rivals appeal more
runners.spotlight: Comes here after two respectable runs, the latter in first-time blinkers, and is now 8lb below last season's winning mark but this high-mileage 10yo might still be vulnerable to younger legs; versatile regarding ground; usual cheekpieces back on today.

runners.name: Formel Park
runners.comment: Unexposed after only four hurdle runs but was pulled up when 33-1 for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only four hurdling starts but was pulled up when 33-1 for handicap debut here (2m5f, good to soft) in November; drops back in trip after four-month break; could be considered only if much stronger in the betting this time.

runners.name: One True King
runners.comment: Had good record here as a handicapper but recent point/hunter chase form is uninspiring
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper chaser when trained by Nigel Twiston-Davies, with a good record at this track; this season's pointing form for new stable has been underwhelming, though, and he was safely held when fourth in a Leicester hunter chase (2m, good to soft) last month.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was a nice performance from One True King so we won't get overexcited, but he jumps beautifully and I'm sure he'll get better over further - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

runners.name: Cap Du Mathan
runners.comment: Useful handicapper in prime and an easy hunter chase winner last season; back from break
runners.spotlight: Useful handicap chaser in his prime and won easily on last season's hunter chase debut at Leicester (2m, soft); absent since below-par run at Stratford last May but will be suited by today's trip/ground and features prominently in calculations.

quotes.race: Summerfield Developments Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
