quotes.quote: Cap Du Mathan won on this day in a hurdle race. He loved it around here, last time at Hereford it was just a bit too heavy. He was much better today and it's great to win for the Stewart family. He stays further than two [miles] so you can be aggressive over that trip and Harry [Cobden] is riding at the top of his game - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a solid handicap chaser who won twice in his first season over fences. His run at Ascot on Saturday will have brought him on considerably, although he's probably rated up to his best and might switch to hunter chases after Christmas. 05-11-23

runners.name: Corporal Jackjones

prev_owners.owner: Jenny Perry, Victor Goaman, Syd Hosie
Jenny Perry, Victor Goaman, Syd Hosie

runners.comment: Made all in a restricted point last month but faces much tougher opposition here
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner for Syd Hosie in spring 2023 but 0-6 over hurdles for that stable last season; came good in points for new connections at fifth attempt, making all in good-ground restricted event at Charlton Horethorne last month, but has much more on his plate here.

runners.name: Take All
runners.comment: Performed well in good hunter chases either side of his open point win in February
runners.spotlight: Performed well in good hunter chases either side of taking a notable scalp in an open point win in February, and was still going okay before falling at third-last fence at last month's Cheltenham Festival; may not be ideally suited by today's faster ground but still commands respect in these much calmer waters.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's improved with every run. We ran him in a bumper around this time last year and he was a bit weak at the time, didn't handle the ground. We were a bit concerned coming here as to whether he'd handle it or not. His mother won for me years back. We'll see what the handicapper does, he'll probably run around Christmas - Seamus Fahey, trainer of Take All

runners.name: Walkin Out
runners.comment: Won five consecutive points before pretty good second in recent C&D hunter chase
runners.spotlight: Won five consecutive points before returning to racing under rules with pretty good second over C&D (good) a fortnight ago; has a bit to find on the figures today but can still make her presence felt.

7:30.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Better Off
runners.comment: 11,000gns yearling; Ubettabelieveit half-sister to Czech 1m1f winner; one of two for yard
runners.spotlight: 11,000gns yearling; fifth foal; Ubettabelieveit half-sister to a Czech 1m1f winner; unraced dam from useful family; a market check is advised (one of two for the yard) but others make greater appeal on paper.

runners.name: Brightling
runners.comment: First foal; dam 6f winner (including AW; RPR 81); likely to improve for this first run
runners.spotlight: By Aclaim; first foal; dam 6f winner (including AW; RPR 81), half-sister to three winners; should have a future but she's likely to improve for this first run.

runners.name: Could Be The Move
runners.comment: Half-sister to six winners; trainer does well with 2yos; fifth Wolverhampton yesterday
runners.spotlight: £40,000 yearling; 11th foal; Far Above half-sister to six winners including Ghaamer (7f-1m including AW/UAE Listed) and Kalaatah (1m4f AW; 97); dam well-bred 1m winner (96); bred to want further but trainer does well with 2yos and she's one to consider; fifth on debut at Wolverhampton (6:00) yesterday.

runners.name: Diamond Alexander
runners.owner: Dave Evans, Mrs C Derham & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Dave Evans, Mrs C Derham & Partner

runners.comment: £100,000 yearling; from a speedy and precocious family; firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: £100,000 yearling; seventh foal; Cotai Glory sister to 5f winner Democracy Dilemma (including 2yo/Listed), half-sister to five winners including Angel Alexander (Group-placed 5f/6f) and Sky Majesty (6f 2yo including Group 2); dam 5f 2yo winner; trainer runs two; firmly in calculations.

runners.name: Museum Piece
runners.owner: D Fish, Mrs F Mahony & Partner
runners.comment: Has a useful pedigree and her yard is in excellent form; chance
runners.spotlight: 36,000gns yearling; fourth foal; Showcasing sister to 5f winner Ganesha (including 2yo/AW; RPR 88), half-sister to 5f winner Talha (84); dam Italian 5f-6f winner (including 2yo/Group 3); yard in excellent form; chance.

runners.name: Shetakesthegold
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
runners.comment: Stable won the Brocklesby on Saturday with the favourite; could go well
runners.spotlight: 13,000gns yearling; sixth foal; Havana Gold half-sister to winners Society Star (5f; RPR 65) and Guitar (7f/8.6f AW; 55); dam well-bred 7f/1m winner (including AW; 66); stable won the Brocklesby on Saturday with the favourite and she could go well, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.name: Social Exclusion
runners.comment: 45,000gns yearling; stable is going well; the betting may be informative
runners.spotlight: 8,000gns foal, 45,000gns yearling; second foal; dam unraced sister to 7f AW winner Dreamcasing (RPR 58), half-sister to French 9.7f/1m2f winner, out of 6f 2yo winner; stable is going well and this Lope Y Fernandez newcomer could be a contender; the betting may be informative.

6:30.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Bintabuha
runners.comment: Closely related to the AW Listed winner Garden Paradise, while the longer trip should suit
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling; looked promising when placed in her first two starts at Newmarket (7f, good) last summer, but her last two efforts weren't so good; no easy task conceding weight to four previous winners on her return, but she is closely related to the AW Listed winner Garden Paradise, while the longer trip should suit on breeding; interesting.

runners.name: Royale Goodnight
runners.owner: Frost, Acloque, Lb, Fw, Clayton & Godsal
runners.comment: Returns from five months off in a hood having undergone wind surgery; market useful.
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when making a successful debut at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) last September, but a well-beaten last of eight in a Newmarket Listed contest (1m, soft) in November; underwent wind surgery soon afterwards and returns from five months off in a first-time hood; market useful.

runners.name: Dojin
runners.breeder: Brook Stud, R Vines & D F Nott Farms
runners.comment: Won a novice over C&D last month; more needed but she is proven in the conditions
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when third of 13 on her Chelmsford debut (1m, Polytrack) in December and improved to win a novice over C&D last month; even more will be needed, but being proven in the conditions must count for something and she is one of the least exposed in the field.

runners.name: Spirit Of Jura
runners.comment: Won twice in January, but was disappointing at Kempton last time; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Won twice in January, a Chelmsford novice (1m, Polytrack) and a four-runner handicap over C&D, but she was disappointing when last of six at Kempton (1m3f, Polytrack) five weeks ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Shielas Well
runners.comment: Won twice last September but will need to hit the ground running to win this on her return
runners.spotlight: Won two 1m handicaps last September, at Newcastle (Tapeta) and at Musselburgh (good), but not seen since a lesser effort at the former track in November; will need to hit the ground running in order to win this on her return.

7:00.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap

runners.name: Oriental Prince
runners.comment: Record since the hood went on reads 1121811 including a win over C&D; major player
runners.spotlight: Record since the hood went on reads 1121811, most of his wins coming at Newcastle but also proving his effectiveness here when successful over C&D on his penultimate outing; carries a 5lb penalty for his Newcastle win (6f, Tapeta) on Saturday, but drops in grade; major player.

stable_tour.quote: He's a homebred and we're hoping maybe he'll do what Eternal Sunshine has done. He's matured a lot and I've given him time. He's had four runs and we'll probably give him a few runs on the all-weather, but I don't think we'll have a hard campaign with him. We'll see how he progresses but he should be a nice horse to follow next year. I hate to saddle him with it but he'd be my dark horse. 02-10-24

runners.name: Guy Fawkes
runners.comment: Needs the drop in trip to bring about a resurgence on his first start without a hood
runners.spotlight: Eight runs for three different trainers and hasn't built on his debut success here (7f) in November 2023; needs the drop in trip to bring about a resurgence on his first start without a hood.

runners.name: Lequinto
runners.comment: Twice placed from 3lb higher around New Year, but has regressed in the meantime
runners.spotlight: Looked to be on the way back when twice placed from 3lb higher around New Year, but has regressed in the meantime and losing run now up to 16; cheekpieces removed after one use.

stable_tour.quote: He ran at Windsor last week in a Sprint Series Qualifier and I thought he was a bit disappointing - he finished last of eight. I thought he might show a little bit more, so we'll have to have a look at him for the next week and see where he goes next. He won't be going to Brighton. 07-08-24

runners.name: The Real Mckay
runners.comment: C&D winner; back off her last winning mark and worth a second look
runners.spotlight: Won twice on the AW for Ivan Furtado last year (including over C&D) and, having undergone wind surgery, has finished fourth in both starts back here since returning in February (the latest on stable debut); back off her last winning mark and worth a second look.

runners.name: Em Jay Kay
runners.comment: C&D winner who suggested he would appreciate the return to 6f when a close third last time
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who remains just 1lb above his last winning mark and suggested he would appreciate the return to this trip when beaten less than a length into third of nine at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last month; shortlisted.

runners.name: Broken Spear
runners.comment: 6f may be on the sharp side for him now and he hasn't run very well here in the past
runners.spotlight: Running well at Newcastle (7f/1m) since returning last month (3313), but this trip may be on the sharp side for him now and he hasn't run very well in his previous visits to Southwell.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Estate Planning Service Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't know about the trip and if Broken Spear would stay or not but we went a nice gallop and he's just picked them off one by one. He feels like a seven furlong horse all day long and he fights as well because the others weren't going away and he just stuck his head down - Kieran Schofield, jockey.

quotes.race: British EBF Supporting Racing To School Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We gave Broken Spear a mid-season break because the ground was too firm - he wants it good to soft. He's a tough and straightforward horse who is all speed. That's him finished for the season - Tony Coyle, trainer.

runners.name: Heroism
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Off six months since a modest effort on AW debut over C&D
runners.spotlight: 0-15 since his successful 2yo debut for Clive Cox and off six months since a modest effort on AW debut over C&D; look elsewhere.

stable_tour.quote: He's another one who physically has done very well over the winter and, while he wasn't quite up to the task in Group company last year, I'm hopeful he can grow in confidence in handicaps to start with this season. He definitely needs a firmer surface. 02-05-23

runners.name: Safari Dream
runners.comment: Fair third last time, but that took his losing run to 23 so even more will be needed
runners.spotlight: Was having his second start back from 144 days off when beaten 2l into third of ten in an amateur riders' event at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) last month; down another 1lb since, but that took his losing run to 23 so even more will be needed.

stable_tour.quote: He was a good two-year-old but had a foot injury which knocked his confidence a little bit but he's become well handicapped. 11-07-24

runners.name: King Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Well treated on the pick of his form on Tapeta during the winter; a player
runners.spotlight: Dual Newcastle winner (5f) who has been mostly running well since returned to the AW in December; off the same mark as when beaten under a length into second of 12 over C&D in December; cheekpieces removed after one use; a player.

8:00.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Forca Timao
runners.comment: Chelmsford fifth was a step back in the right direction but he needs another today
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to fall and January's Chelmsford fifth (1m2f) was a step back in the right direction; however, he needs another today if he's to add to his sole win from back in 2022; beaten 15 times since.

quotes.race: Parliament Square EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Forca Timao was very good, we have always held him in nice regard. He has improved a lot from his first run and will improve again. He is a lovely colt going forward - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I couldn't believe how moderately he ran first time out at Sandown last year, but after a break he won well as the 40-1 outsider of the field at Doncaster over seven furlongs. He's as handsome a horse as you'll see and I think he'll make up into a very useful colt at around a mile and a quarter. 02-05-23

runners.name: Market House
runners.comment: Has done well since joining this yard and he's a leading contender now back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Won at Newcastle (1m4f, Tapeta) on March 4 on second stable start and followed up there (1m4f) six days later; outstayed when runner-up over 2m there last Tuesday and he's a leading contender in first-time cheekpieces now back down in trip.

runners.name: Bunker Bay
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but respectable fourth over C&D recently and might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Has a poor strike-rate and he didn't look straightforward under pressure when fourth at 100-1 over C&D a fortnight ago; however, that was still a positive performance and he might not be far away in first-time blinkers.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big scopey horse who'll hopefully get a run at the backend. He'll come into his own next year and we'll start him off over a mile. 03-09-21

runners.name: Sant Alessio
runners.comment: 0-8 but beaten just a neck at Wolverhampton last month; can be thereabouts once more
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but positive tactics were re-employed at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) last month and he returned to form to be beaten just a neck; there's every chance he'll be thereabouts once more.

runners.name: Rampant
runners.comment: 0-17 but consistent for this stable and close third at Newcastle last Tuesday
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden but he's been consistent for this stable and was a close third in a first-time visor (retained) at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) last Tuesday; could be in the mix.

runners.name: Tuco Salamanca
runners.comment: 3-3 since undergoing wind surgery in the autumn; much respected despite his 6lb penalty
runners.spotlight: 3-3 since undergoing wind surgery in the autumn, his latest success coming at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) on Saturday; no problem with the return to further and much respected despite his 6lb penalty.

runners.name: Best Adventure
runners.comment: In the frame in all four starts on turf last year; worth monitoring in market on return
runners.spotlight: 650,000gns yearling; in the frame in all four starts on turf last year, including when third of seven on nursery debut at Doncaster (1m, good) in September (gelded soon afterwards); brother to an AW winner and well worth monitoring in the market on his return.

runners.name: Everyoneknowsadave
runners.comment: 4lb higher than when successful over C&D in January; watch market on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: 2-3 on Tapeta for Amy Murphy, his latest win coming from 4lb lower over C&D (first-time cheekpieces) in January; changed hands for 30,000gns soon afterwards and worth a market check on stable debut after 75 days off.

runners.name: Canvas
runners.comment: Makes his debut for his third different stable after 225 days off; market informative
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in all four starts over 6f/7f on turf/Tapeta last year, but makes his debut for his third different stable after 225 days off having been gelded since last seen; market should be informative.

runners.name: West Tyrone
runners.comment: Has improved since going handicapping, winning well over C&D last time; major player
runners.spotlight: Has improved since going handicapping with cheekpieces applied, going down narrowly at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in February before making all to beat a subsequent winner with some authority over C&D last month; up another 5lb, but still open to further progress and a major player.

runners.name: Sir David
runners.breeder: Al Shaqab Racing & S C E A Des Prairies
runners.comment: Half-brother to an AW winner in France; watch market on handicap debut after 173 days off
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when third over 6f in the first two of his four starts on turf last year (stiff task over 7f on final outing); half-brother to an AW winner in France; should stay this far and worth a market check on handicap debut after six months off.

runners.name: Cristo
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxvii And Partner
runners.comment: Half-brother to a couple of Tapeta winners and respected on return from six months off
runners.spotlight: Best of six starts as a 2yo when beaten half a length into second of six at Ripon (1m, soft) on his final outing; half-brother to a couple of Tapeta winners and respected on return from six months off, especially if market is positive.

runners.name: Political Power

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Record on the AW since joining this yard reads 24242, but 7f may suit him better
runners.spotlight: Record on the AW since joining this yard reads 24242, finishing a long way clear of the third when runner-up in a Wolverhampton novice (7f, Tapeta) 16 days ago; has the form to figure back in a handicap, but a shorter trip may suit him better.

runners.name: Bulletin
runners.comment: In the frame in three starts on Tapeta last autumn; watch market on handicap debut/return
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in all three starts on Tapeta in the autumn, including when beaten a head (clear of the third) in a maiden over C&D on his second outing (gelded soon after third start); makes his handicap debut after 137 days off and the market should indicate what is expected.

runners.name: Ventura Dream
runners.comment: C&D winner in February but well behind Tuco Salamanca last time; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Made all on handicap debut over C&D in February (first start since being gelded), but finished over 5l behind Tuco Salamanca when beating one home at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last month; needs to bounce back in the first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Genbu
runners.comment: Twice second on turf before well held on Polytrack; market useful on handicap debut/return
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in his first two starts at Catterick (7f, soft) in October, but well held at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) the following month; market useful now making his handicap debut after 133 days off.

runners.name: Eighteen Fourteen
runners.comment: Won a Redcar novice last summer, but twice well held afterwards; watch market on return
runners.spotlight: Narrowly landed a Redcar novice (6f, good to firm) last summer, but well held in both subsequent starts including at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) on his final outing (gelded soon afterwards); should stay this far and market useful back from six months off.

runners.name: Minelone
runners.comment: 0-6 but in the frame five times; probably should have won last time; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but in the frame five times, albeit he probably should have won when beaten a head and a nose into third of eight over C&D last month (West Tyrone won the other division in a quicker time); each-way claims again.

8:30.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Balgowan
runners.comment: 0-21 under rules, but runner-up in three of his four starts this year; a player
runners.spotlight: 0-21 under rules, but has finished runner-up in three of his four starts this year and had four of these behind when second of ten in a steadily run contest over C&D 12 days ago; a player from the same mark.

runners.name: Fiftyshadesaresdev
runners.breeder: Earl Mell Elevages & Mr F & Mrs M Mell
runners.comment: Running well lately and close behind Balgowan over C&D last time, but is 0-32 under rules
runners.spotlight: Running well in defeat lately and was attempting this far for the first time on the Flat when third of ten over C&D 12 days ago, finishing less than a length behind Balgowan; now 0-32 under rules, though.

runners.name: Unification
runners.comment: Out of the frame in 11 starts for three different trainers
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in 11 starts for three different trainers and finished tailed off at Newcastle (2m, Tapeta) last month; visor removed after one use.

runners.name: Leon Trotsky
runners.comment: Held over C&D last time but had won well the time before; a player granted a better gallop
runners.spotlight: Wasn't suited by the steady gallop when behind two of these over C&D 12 days ago, but had won well here the time before; with a few in here having made the running in the past this may be run at better tempo and he would be high on the list if it is.

runners.name: Scylla
runners.comment: 5lb below sole winning mark, but was behind three of these over C&D 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: 5lb lower than when gaining her sole success at Lingfield (2m, good to firm; first-time cheekpieces) last summer; ran well when third of ten at Wolverhampton (1m6f, Tapeta; first-time blinkers) last month, but was behind three of these over C&D nine days later.

runners.name: Yakhabar
runners.comment: Both wins at Newcastle early last year, but still to prove he truly wants this far
runners.spotlight: Both wins at Newcastle (1m4f, Tapeta) early last year, but operating at a lower level now and still to prove he truly wants this far.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap
quotes.quote: Yakhabar is generally held up but everything else in the race was held up also, so I thought we'd take a chance and go forward and I think that's what's won him the race - Liam Bailey, trainer.

runners.name: Typewritten
runners.comment: Just beaten over 2m at Newcastle in January, but has regressed since; others preferred
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come over 1m4f on Tapeta; could be given a chance on her narrow defeat at Newcastle (2m, Tapeta) in January, but she has regressed since and her losing run is up to 24; others preferred.

runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.comment: This is her first start beyond 7f and quite what she will make of it remains to be seen
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come at Chelmsford for other stables; has won fresh before, but this is her first start beyond 7f and quite what she will make of it remains to be seen.

runners.name: Kittens Dream

prev_owners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton

runners.comment: C&D winner, but losing run up to 39 and a long time since he showed any worthwhile form
runners.spotlight: Two of his three AW wins have come here including over this trip, but losing run now up to 39 and it's a long time since he showed any worthwhile form.

runners.name: Spartan Times
runners.comment: 0-8; has something to prove on this first start beyond 1m4f
runners.spotlight: 0-8; has shown some ability at a modest level but has something to prove on this first start beyond 1m4f.

5:30.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Northbound
runners.comment: 2-4 around here and possible to make excuses for last two defeats; high on list
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return from six months off over 1m here in February and possible to make excuses for his two defeats since; his other course win came over this trip and high on list back at this venue; stable won a division of this last year.

runners.name: Heretic

prev_owners.owner: Highclere Tbred Racing, C Fahy & Partner

runners.comment: Third over 1m here last time; possibilities if taking another step forward; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Not much in his first five starts for this yard after returning from 21 months off in October, but ran better when third of eight here (1m) 12 days ago; possibilities if taking another step forward with cheekpieces applied.

runners.name: Heerathetrack
runners.comment: 3-42 with his wins coming on Polytrack, but has run well over C&D; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: 3-42 with his wins coming on Polytrack, the latest at Chelmsford (1m) last month; ran well in one previous go over C&D and not dismissed from 3lb higher.

runners.name: Sams Hope
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D on her penultimate outing; each-way claims on that; visor on
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since winning at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) for Richard Hannon just over a year ago; 1lb higher than when second of eight over C&D on her penultimate outing and each-way claims if repeating that; visor now given a go.

runners.name: Spirit Of Bowland
runners.comment: Back off his last winning mark; market may indicate what is expected after 400 days off
runners.spotlight: Completed a Tapeta hat-trick in the spring of 2023 including a win over 1m here; now back off his last winning mark, but the market may be the best indication of what to expect from him after 400 days off.

runners.name: Galileo Glass
runners.comment: 2lb lower than when third of nine over C&D on his penultimate outing so a case can be made
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since returning from another break in January, though is 2lb lower than when third of nine over C&D on his penultimate outing so a case can be made; cheekpieces removed after one use.

runners.name: Urban Dandy
runners.comment: Needs to show he can still be competitive back in handicap company; a player if he can
runners.spotlight: Course winner (6f) who has been in good form in 0-50 classified events at Newcastle so far this year (2212), but needs to show he can still be competitive back in handicap company; a player if he can.

runners.name: Create
runners.owner: Dixon, Wylam, M Baldry, J&S Harrod
runners.comment: 14lb lower than when winning at Doncaster last summer, but poor in the meantime
runners.spotlight: Course winner (1m) who is 14lb lower than when winning at Doncaster (7f, good) last summer, but her efforts in the meantime (mostly back here) leave plenty to be desired.

runners.name: Vivency
runners.comment: Made the frame here in her first three starts of the year; could do so again
runners.spotlight: 2-39, but made the frame over 6f/7f here in her first three starts of the year; not the greatest surprise if she did so again (had excuses last time).

runners.name: Rainbow Mirage
runners.comment: Losing run up to 20 and little sign lately of her turning things around
runners.spotlight: Has dropped a long way in the weights, but losing run now up to 20 and little sign lately of her turning things around.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: They went hard enough up front which suited Rainbow Mirage and I'm pleased to win on my first ride for the stable - George Rooke, jockey.

6:00.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Lincolns Inn
runners.comment: Unplaced in all six starts; enough to prove back from another absence
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all six starts, the last five on Tapeta; down in grade but still has enough to prove back from another absence.

runners.name: Dumfries
runners.owner: Buist, Shields, Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: 1-22 but twice placed off higher marks in the autumn; worth a second look
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 22 starts came in a 1m maiden here as a 3yo; could be given a chance on his placed efforts off higher marks in the autumn and the stable won a division of this last year; worth a second look.

stable_tour.quote: He was a winner of a Southwell maiden for Marcus Tregoning and he ran well back there for us first time this season, where he wasn't beaten too far. He's a miler. I can't find anything for him back at Southwell, so I'm hoping the ground has dried up a bit for him at Pontefract on April 22. 17-04-24

runners.name: Royal Justice
runners.comment: 0-8; out of the frame in three visits here including both since joining this yard
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in four of her six starts for John and Sean Quinn last year, but hasn't set the world alight in three previous visits here including both since joining this yard; look elsewhere.

runners.name: Fistral Beach
runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick after wins over C&D and at Newcastle last month; big player again
runners.spotlight: It took her 15 attempts to get off the mark, but she now bids for a hat-trick from another 3lb higher after wins over C&D and at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) last month; likely to play a big part again.

runners.name: Margot Robbie
runners.comment: In good form since returning from 403 days off in February; respected back in a handicap
runners.spotlight: In good form since returning from 403 days off in February with cheekpieces applied, just touched off in a handicap over C&D and going one better in a 0-50 classified event at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta); has a higher mark to contend with back in a handicap, but still respected.

runners.name: Bandello
runners.comment: 0-9 and finished behind Fistral Beach at Newcastle last time; much more needed
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who finished around 5l behind Fistral Beach when seventh of ten on stable debut at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta; first-time cheekpieces) last month; much more needed.

runners.name: Fifty Sent
runners.comment: No doubting his consistency, but a record of 1-32 is hard to ignore
runners.spotlight: No doubting his consistency and he appeared to have no problem with the drop in trip when beaten a neck and a nose into third of 11 over C&D last Friday; visor returns, but a record of 1-32 is hard to ignore.

runners.name: Grecian God
runners.comment: 9lb lower than for his sole success at Wolverhampton last August; not easily dismissed
runners.spotlight: Not shown a great deal lately, but has dropped 9lb lower than when recording his sole success at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last August; not easily dismissed.

runners.name: Max Stripes
runners.comment: 0-9; made the frame three times but achieved little
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in three of his seven starts on turf, but didn't achieve much on each occasion and the switch to the AW has made little difference.

4:02.race_name: Golf At Gowran Park (C & G) Maiden

runners.name: Ainm Bentley
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival when 80-1 on sole two-year-old start; best watched on return
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival when 80-1 on sole two-year-old start; best watched on return to action.

runners.name: Amplitude
runners.comment: Son of Invincible Army; 5,000eur yearling; pedigree suggests he may want further; gelded
runners.spotlight: Son of Invincible Army; cost 5,000euros as a yearling; half-brother to winners Beautot (French 9.5f/Spanish 10.5f including AW; RPR 87) and Mortree (French 1m4f-2m); dam Listed-placed 1m1f/1m2f 2yo winner (stayed 1m4f; 100); gelded and probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Broadstone
runners.comment: Beaten 5l when 6th in Curragh maiden last year; gelded with hood fitted for return
runners.spotlight: Beaten roughly 5l when sixth of 15 in a Curragh maiden last season and the form of that race has a solid look to it; gelded since last seen and returns with a hood fitted; respected given that some of the yard's runners have been tuned up for their seasonal returns.

runners.name: Galaxy Wonder
runners.comment: Low-key debut when 7th at Dundalk in Feb'; needs a good chunk of improvement to figure
runners.spotlight: Low-key debut when seventh of 11 over this trip at Dundalk in February; will need a good chunk of improvement to have a say here.

runners.name: General Grant
runners.comment: 30,000eur yearling; half-brother to 5 winners; gelded and tongue-tie on for debut
runners.spotlight: Son of Invincible Army; cost 30,000euros as a yearling; half-brother to five winners including Consulting (6f/7f AW including 2yo; RPR 86) and Clergyman (6f AW including 2yo; 81); dam unraced half-sister to 1m6f Listed winner On Call and to 5f/6f winner Doctor's Glory (dam of five Group/Listed winners); gelded and tongue-tie fitted for debut; watching brief advised here.

runners.name: Gold Dublooms
runners.comment: Slowly away and only beat one home when 250-1 for his debut; tongue-tie now tried
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and only beat one home when 250-1 for his debut; tongue-tie now tried.

runners.name: Gran Habano
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Promise on AW this winter; only beat 1 home in sole start at 1m; yard started season fast
runners.spotlight: Some promising efforts on AW this winter and would be in the mix with a repeat of his best efforts but only beat one home on his sole start at 1m in seven-runner contest at Dundalk and he was a beaten favourite when fifth of 13 in a 6f Dundalk maiden last time out; could be vulnerable, despite yard's fast start to the season.

runners.name: Paddydaddy
runners.comment: Outpaced in 7f/1m maidens last term; gelded; may be of more interest over further
runners.spotlight: Outpaced in a pair of Curragh maidens over 7f and 1m last season but showed ability; gelded since; may be of more interest when tried over further; widest draw.

runners.name: Ribee
runners.comment: Low-key debut but showed more when 5th last week; should improve return to further
runners.spotlight: Low-key debut over this trip at Dundalk but showed more when fifth at Naas (7f, soft to heavy) last week; should improve stepping back up in distance.

runners.name: Standard Deviation
runners.breeder: Gerrardstown House Stud & I N S
runners.comment: Invincible Spirit gelding; 37,000gns yearling; may want a bit further
runners.spotlight: Invincible Spirit gelding; cost 37,000gns as a yearling; half-brother to Hungarian 1m2f winner Flying Aquangel; dam unraced sister to Italian 1m3f Listed winner Leo Gali and half-sister to 1m4f Group 3 winner Hazel Lavery (dam of 1m Group 1 winner The Revenant); yard can ready newcomers and worth a market check but may want a bit further.

runners.name: The Liffey Swim
runners.comment: £110,000 yearling; yard can ready one but cheekpieces for debut may not be a good sign
runners.spotlight: Son of Kodiac; cost 52,000gns as a foal and £110,000 as a yearling; dam last only start (RPR 36), half-sister to 6f 2yo/1m Listed winner Drumfad Bay, out of 1m2f Group 2 winner Manieree; yard can ready one but cheekpieces for debut may not be a good sign.

runners.name: Wild Sapphire
runners.comment: Well bred; went close behind subsequent Dewhurt 2nd on debut; 1m on good may be ideal
runners.spotlight: Well bred colt who went close on debut at the Curragh last season and the winner from that contest (Expanded) finished runner-up in the Dewhurt on only run since; wasn't as good on soft at Leopardstown when last seen but 1m on better ground could be ideal and yard are in form.

runners.name: Royal Pippen
runners.comment: Losing run goes back to 2021; hinting at a revival at end of last term; may want it softer
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back to 2021 but was hinting at a revival towards the end of last season; may want the ground a bit softer than what is likely but not ruled out, despite 156-day absence.

runners.name: Pub Talk
runners.comment: Lost his way in last 2 years but return wasn't devoid of promise; mixed record at 1m
runners.spotlight: Lost his way over the last couple of years but recent return on AW (6f) wasn't devoid of promise; mixed record at 1m but down to a good mark.

quotes.race: Grant Thornton Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Pub Talk found a mile at Killarney too far and 5.5f at Navan too short, so we got it right in between here. Funnily enough, Colin (Keane) said our horse felt a bit intimidated by another horse (in the straight), and it wasn't until he put his whip down that he actually ran on. He came home well enough. Colin thinks fast surfaces or something like Dundalk will suit this horse so that's probably where we'll go - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Naisiun
runners.comment: Sole win came at 7f on heavy; stays further; sole win on last year's return; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over 7f on heavy but stays further and the win came on last season's reappearance; drawn out wide but this isn't a strong event and she's less exposed than most of these.

quotes.race: King Of Change At Compas Stallions Handicap
quotes.quote: Naisiun wasn't catching the favourite until about 100 yards from the line and stamina really came into play. Our horses are fit. Hopefully we'll find something similar for her again, she handled the ground very well - Ger Flynn, assistant trainer

runners.name: Nibras Rainbow
runners.comment: Ended losing run over 1m last August; hit and miss since; probably best watched fresh
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing run over this trip at Killarney last August; was a bit hit and miss subsequently and he has a modest record fresh.

runners.name: Higher Kingdom
runners.comment: All 6 wins on AW and 0-22 on turf; only beat one home on yard debut; wide draw
runners.spotlight: All six wins have come on AW and 0-22 on turf; only beat one home on yard debut 12 days ago but was well backed; likely best watched back on turf with the widest draw.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Serengeti Sunrise

prev_owners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
Ms E L Banks And R L Banks

runners.comment: Ran okay on sole turf start but hasn't shown enough in five AW runs for his new yard
runners.spotlight: Won on AW (7f) in 2023; ran okay on sole turf start but hasn't shown enough in five AW runs for his new yard.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him back as I think he can keep improving. I wasn't particularly overwhelmed with his first run but I think he's not taken the cold winter as well as some of the other horses in the yard. He's not quite come to himself and we'll see how he goes on the grass, but I could see him taking a big step forward as he just strengthens up. 29-03-24

runners.name: Suityourselfboss
runners.comment: 1-21 and 0-6 on turf; out of form since her win a year ago; no signs of a revival latest
runners.spotlight: 1-21 and 0-6 on turf; out of form since her win a year ago and no signs of a revival at Dundalk last month.

runners.name: Bucky Larson
runners.comment: Veteran who has come a long way down the weights but struggling on AW recently
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has come a long way down the weights but struggling on AW recently, beaten 7l on Friday; others preferred.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has been coming down the handicap all year and I felt the last day that he was something like himself. He was entitled to do that - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has a bit of class in races like that. He's a good lead horse at home and pulls one out of the bag every so often - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: "Paddy & Saoirse Casey" Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson is still a baby of a horse but we think he'll get ten furlongs in time. He's a lovely individual, he's growing up and I'd say there's another day or two in him - Ger Lyons, trainer

quotes.race: Leopardstown Summer Pass Maiden
quotes.quote: We rode him all wrong at Dundalk. We don't take back from the stalls and it was just the wrong way to ride him.His work at home had been good and he loves hunting one down. That's what we were expecting him to do at Dundalk and we were disappointed last time but I'd rather win here - Ger Lyons, trainer

runners.name: Chou Chou
runners.comment: 0-17; tailed off over timber when last seen and out of form on Flat previously
runners.spotlight: 0-17; tailed off over hurdles when last seen and had not been shaping like a return to form was imminent on the level prior to that hurdle debut; off three months and others preferred.

runners.name: Top Of The Pops
runners.comment: Won on debut but no wins since; only beat 3 home in 20-runner h'cap on Sunday
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Leicester in 2020 but no wins since and only beat three home in 20-runner handicap on Sunday.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Reference Point Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Top Of The Pops was really determined to win. He battled very well and was quite impressive on this heavy ground. He's a typical horse from Mark Johnston's stable - once he got his head in front he just kept fighting. He was very professional and the further he goes, the better he will be - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

runners.name: Hope And Innocence
runners.comment: 0-28; new trip maybe too far latest; some good runs on AW this winter but record a concern
runners.spotlight: 28-race maiden; new trip was probably too far when beaten 10l last month; some good runs on AW this winter but her record is a concern.

runners.name: Love Mocha
runners.comment: Minor promise for former yard but shown nothing for new connections; off 298 days
runners.spotlight: Minor promise for Jessica Harrington a couple of years ago; shown nothing for new connections and has been off 298 days; wears first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Royal Tribute
runners.comment: Went close on AW in December but seems to have lost his way at Dundalk of late
runners.spotlight: Both wins came over 7f in 2022; went close on AW in December but seems to have lost his way at Dundalk of late.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Golf Course & Driving Range Handicap
quotes.quote: Royal Tribute can quicken when things fall his way, it couldn't have panned out much better - Seamie Heffernan, rider

runners.name: Bonnie Moon
runners.comment: Half-sister to 1m6f/2m winner Alex The Great, dam by Dalakhani a Listed winner over 1m6f
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to 1m6f/2m AW winner Alex The Great; dam, by Dalakhani, was a Listed winner over 1m6f for Ralph Beckett and won over 2m.

runners.name: Can I Kiss You
runners.comment: Two runs at Dundalk, first attempt over 1m better than subsequent run over extended 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Two runs at Dundalk; first attempt over 1m better than subsequent run over extended 1m2f.

runners.name: Deressa
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: Fair standard of form in four runs at two, close up in fourth over C&D in October;
runners.spotlight: Achieved a fair standard of form in four runs at two; cheekpieces worn when fifth of 16 at Galway in September are back on having been left off when she was close up in fourth over C&D in October; form of that race got a recent minor boost with a win for third-placed J M's Joy at the Curragh.

runners.name: Lisnadill
runners.comment: Considerable improvement needed from two Dundalk run, safely held by Nuit.
runners.spotlight: Considerable improvement needed from two Dundalk runs; safely held by Nuit.

runners.name: Now U Have It
runners.comment: Not a bad run in mid-field over C&D on debut though held by Deressa on that evidence
runners.spotlight: Not a bad run in mid-field over C&D on debut though held by Deressa on that evidence; failed to improve at Dundalk on second start.

runners.name: Nuit
runners.comment: Third in maidens at Naas and Dundalk, some positives but rated 7lb inferior to Deressa
runners.spotlight: Made a bright introduction when third in a 1m Naas maiden won by Aidan O'Brien trained colt Galveston (unplaced off 87 in a handicap at Leopardstown on Sunday); form of Dundalk third behind Carolinea Jetstream (winner again since) suggests she should go close.

runners.name: Win Me Over
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: Fourth of 20 on debut at the Curragh, should be a lot better for that experience
runners.spotlight: A sister to top-class miler Palace Pier (five Group 1s including the St James's Palace, Queen Anne and Prix Jacques le Marois twice); easy-to-back (13-2) on debut over 7f at the Curragh last month; raced prominently and finished fourth of 20; should be a lot better for that experience; runner-up fared quite well in a Group 3 event on Sunday.

5:45.race_name: Gowran Park Racing Club (C & G) Maiden

runners.name: Broadchurch
runners.comment: 66-1 down the field in a 27-runner maiden at the Curragh on only start at two
runners.spotlight: Dam is a sister to Group 1 winner Holy Roman Emperor; 66-1 down the field in a 27-runner maiden at the Curragh on only start at two.

runners.name: Crooked Path
runners.comment: Stayed on in mid-field on debut in a 1m maiden at the Curragh, longer trip should help.
runners.spotlight: Stayed on in mid-field on debut in a 1m maiden at the Curragh last month; longer trip should help.

runners.name: Eastwatch
runners.comment: Promising debut at Tipperary last October, form boosted by the second Serious Contender
runners.spotlight: Made a pleasing introduction when third over 1m at Tipperary last October; runner-up Serious Contender has franked the form with two Leopardstown wins, including a handicap off 87 on Sunday's card.

runners.name: Enziya
runners.comment: Fair fifth at this venue on debut, not disgraced at the Curragh, cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Recovered from a slow start when a fair fifth of ten at this venue last October; had plenty of horses behind at the Curragh on his only other start; fitted with cheekpieces now.

runners.name: Glenroyal
runners.comment: lost all chance at the start when apprentice-ridden on debut at Dundalk 12 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Brother to Irish Cesarewitch winner Magellan Strait, half-brother to five winners including useful dual-purpose type Lagostovegas; lost all chance at the start when apprentice-ridden on debut at Dundalk 12 days ago.

runners.name: Joe Cool
runners.comment: Seventh foal; half-brother to three winners, dam French turf/AW winner, champion aboard
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-brother to three winners; dam French turf/AW winner, half-sister to 1m2f Group 3 winner Monty; champion aboard.

runners.name: Kingstonian
runners.comment: Did not appear again after a nondescript debut at Leopardstown last August, plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Did not appear again after a nondescript debut at Leopardstown last August; in top hands but plenty to find.

runners.name: Littlesumpinsumpin
runners.comment: Dam a four-time winner for Jim Bolger, from a predominantly jumps stable
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam, by Dawn Approach, a four-time winner for Jim Bolger; from a predominantly jumps stable.

runners.name: Methgal
runners.comment: Three runs in Britain at two, placed over 1m, probably needs to improve to feature here
runners.spotlight: Ran three times in Britain at two; went closest when fourth of six over 7f at Haydock, best placing when third of 11 over 1m at Ayr; probably needs to improve to feature here.

runners.name: Paul Henry
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Relatively modest pedigree profile by the stable's usual standards, respected all the same
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to multiple minor winner Pop Favorite; dam 7f winner by Oasis Dream, sister to French 7f 2yo Group 1 winner Naaqoos; relatively modest pedigree profile by the stable's usual standards; respected all the same.

runners.name: Thunder Wolf
runners.comment: Half-brother to four winners, including Listed scorer Thunder Beauty, dam German winner.
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-brother to four winners including stable's Listed scorer Thunder Beauty; dam German middle-distance winner.

runners.name: Diesel Deans
runners.comment: Poet's Word gelding; half-brother to Moss Tucker; dam won at this trip; belated debut
runners.spotlight: Poet's Word gelding; half-brother to 5f-7.4f winner Moss Tucker (including Group 1; RPR 117); dam 1m/9.4f Flat (89) and 2m/2m2f hurdle winner, half-sister to US 1m4f Grade 3 winner; some appeal on pedigree; check market

runners.name: Disco Boy
runners.comment: Promise in bumpers and similar story on level; has each-way claims dropping in trip
runners.spotlight: Shown promise in bumpers and similar story since he's been switched to the Flat; each-way claims despite the drop back in trip.

runners.name: Extrapolation
runners.comment: Produced career best on penultimate outing; not at same level latest and off 257 days
runners.spotlight: Produced a career best over fences (2m1f) on his penultimate outing; not at that same level when last seen though and he's been off 257 days; might need further in this sphere.

quotes.race: McHale Tiger Roll Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Coming here today it looked a hot beginners', but then the favourite came out. I still thought it would be tough task against a 137-rated chaser in Mighty Tom, but Extrapolation loves good ground like that and it's terrific to get the win - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Harrington Concrete & Quarries Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Extrapolation grasped a nice opportunity here and he did it well. He moved up into it well and he ran on nicely - Danny Mullins, rider

quotes.race: Racing TV INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: I thought Extrapolation had run two very good races on testing ground and this was lesser opposition. He did it well and could go for a Flat race, maybe the amateurs' race in Galway. He won't go on very deep winter ground - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Gambino
runners.comment: Churchill gelding; 45,000eur yearling; brother to 1m winner Triple Trouble; Keane booked
runners.spotlight: Churchill gelding; cost 45,000euros as a yearling; brother to French 1m winner Triple Trouble; dam unplaced 5f-1m (RPR 56), closely related to 6f Listed winner Pirate Jenny, half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Barraquero; Keane booked and worth a market check on belated debut.

runners.name: Khormor Syd
runners.comment: Well held at 200s on debut but made late headway and new trip may suit
runners.spotlight: Well held 200-1 shot in a Galway maiden in October but made some late headway and this new trip will probably suit; each-way squeak.

runners.name: Silas Marner
runners.comment: Went close in bumpers a few years ago; well held both Flat starts over 1m6f; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Went close in a couple of bumpers a few years ago; has shown nothing in two Flat runs at 1m6f though and this trip looks short.

runners.name: Skib Gold
runners.comment: Havana Gold gelding; half-brother to six winners but not really bred for this trip
runners.spotlight: Havana Gold gelding; half-brother to six winners including Switcher (Group-placed 6f 2yo; RPR 105), Marine Boy (6f 2yo; 104) and Jeanie Johnston (6f-1m5f; 91); dam French 7.5f 2yo winner; not really bred for this trip.

runners.name: Ardlena
runners.comment: Invincible Army filly; dam sister to 2 winners; tongue-tie for debut; likely to need this
runners.spotlight: Invincible Army filly; dam unraced sister to winners Salouen (Group 1-placed 1m-1m4f) and Masonbrook Lady (1m3f/1m4f), half-sister to winners Madernia (French 10.5f-1m5f) and What Will Be (1m6f AW Flat/2m hurdle); tongue-tie on for debut and likely to need this.

runners.name: Awakening
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Shaped with promise on debut when beaten 6l; may have found ground too heavy since
runners.spotlight: Shaped with promise on debut when beaten roughly 6l in a Curragh maiden and may have found heavy ground too testing on her only subsequent starts; new yard returning from 177 days off.

runners.name: Fianna
runners.comment: Stayed on for 4th in 1m4f heavy ground maiden; 4th at Clonmel since; should be involved
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for fourth in a 1m4f heavy ground maiden at Roscommon and filled the same spot when beaten 6l in a Clonmel fillies' maiden; should be in the mix if fit on return from 209 days off.

runners.name: Parish Express
runners.comment: Parish Hall filly; dam sister to 1m2f winner; suitable trip; market may reveal expectation
runners.spotlight: Parish Hill filly; dam unraced sister to 1m2f winner Ambitious Approach, out of once-raced half-sister to 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner Istimraar; trip should suit and handy draw; market may reveal expectations.

runners.name: Royal Hollow
runners.comment: Beaten 2l on Flat debut; progressing over hurdles since; major player back on level
runners.spotlight: Was only beaten 2l on Flat debut and has been progressing over hurdles since; major player back in this sphere if she handles the drop in trip.

runners.name: Spring Dance
runners.comment: Dubawi filly; changed yards twice already without running; cost 350,000euros in Dec'
runners.spotlight: Dubawi filly; changed yards twice already without running; cost 350,000euros in December; dam 7f winner (including 2yo/Listed; RPR 104), half-sister to prolific Australian 5f-1m2f winner Anamoe (including multiple Group 1s), out of Australian 1m2f Group 1 winning half-sister to Australian 5.5f Group 1 winner Drum; fascinating newcomer given her recent sale price.

runners.name: Victoria Kesia
runners.comment: Has been in the frame in four of her last five starts and sets the standard on form
runners.spotlight: Has been in the frame in four of her last five starts; a narrow defeat at Killarney on her penultimate start stayed on for a distant second over C&D when last seen; sets the standard.

6:45.race_name: Thanks To All Our Sponsors Handicap

runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: 0-19 and has looked regressive this winter; return to turf is fine but others stronger
runners.spotlight: 0-19 and has looked regressive this winter; return to turf is fine but others look stronger.

runners.name: Thatwilldoso
runners.comment: Left h'cap debut behind when narrowly denied when last seen; should go well if fit enough
runners.spotlight: Left her handicap debut behind at Killarney when signing off last season with a narrow defeat at the Curragh over a similar trip; that form worked out okay and she ought to go well if fit enough on her return.

runners.name: Venting
runners.comment: Promising enough debut when sixth at Navan but was tailed off in two subsequent starts
runners.spotlight: Promising enough debut when sixth at Navan but was tailed off in two subsequent starts; handicapper hasn't taken any chances.

runners.name: Deep Sigh
runners.comment: Losing run since heavy ground success in 2021; out of form over timber in last 12 months
runners.spotlight: Losing run since heavy ground success at Doncaster in 2021; out of form over hurdles in the last 12 months; may need further than this these days.

runners.name: Lord Talbot
runners.owner: Elaine Shevlin & David Boylan & Ms Denise Mccourt
runners.comment: Winner on h'cap bow but well held twice since at 1m4f; needs drop in trip to spark revival
runners.spotlight: Winner on handicap debut in November but well held twice since over 1m4f; needs the drop back in trip to spark a revival.

runners.name: Magic Charm
runners.comment: Out of form when last seen but placed in last 2 seasonal return; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Out of form towards the end of last season but has hit the frame on his last two seasonal reappearances; new headgear (cheekpieces) for his return.

quotes.race: Ornella Underwriting Ltd Equine And Bloodstock Insurance Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Magic Charm is a genuine horse but the blinkers maybe just helped him travel. He ran a savage race last day and we knew today that the stiff track and soft ground would help him - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Welcomes Racing TV Members Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Magic Charm had a good solid run the last day and has proved to be competitive at this level before today. All the conditions were right so we were hopeful -Natalia Lupini, trainer

runners.name: Share The Treasure

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D F O'Rourke & Mrs Josephine Hogan & Denis F Howard

runners.comment: 0-9; went close here last term but didn't build on that subsequently; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; went close over 7f here in July but didn't build on that subsequently; wears first-time tongue-tie and might need this returning from 212 days off.

runners.name: Tatum
runners.comment: 0-8; placed in 3 h'caps in 2023; not at best either run last term
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden but placed in three handicaps (including over C&D) in 2023; wasn't right on either start last season and off 163 days but not ruled out.

runners.name: Dazzling Spirit
runners.comment: 4-time h'cap winner on turf; struggling at end of last term; best watched on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Four-time handicap winner on turf but struggling at end of last term and probably best watched on yard debut returning from 163 days off.

quotes.race: St. Patrick's Well Handicap
quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit won here last year and I hoped coming back here would work. She ran away with him down the hill but Jamie gets on well with her, that's his fourth win on her - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN The Advantage Series Handicap
quotes.quote: During the summer jockeys were saying Dazzling Spirit needed a little bit further but she just wouldn't let herself down on the ground. On the soft she's letting herself down and she's getting quicker, that's why I took a chance coming back to seven. At home she's very speedy and her half-sister Powersville was a five or six-furlong mare. She'll go to Galway now for a seven-furlong handicap and that might see her out for the season - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: St. Patrick's Well Handicap
quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit got a lovely run up the rail. She travelled well and hit the line well, she was still a bit green and ran around a bit. She was a bit unlucky last time but she enjoyed herself today - Jamie Powell, rider.

runners.name: Cloughaneely Mor
runners.comment: Hasn't threatened in 10 runs so far and has been off 140 days
runners.spotlight: Hasn't threatened in 10 runs so far and has been off 140 days.

runners.name: Knockmore Prince
runners.comment: 0-24; best form on AW and didn't shape like his turn was near in two starts last month
runners.spotlight: 24-race maiden; best form on AW and didn't shape like his turn was near in two starts last month.

runners.name: Persian Bliss
runners.comment: Consistent form at Dundalk; has race fitness on his side and could make his presence felt
runners.spotlight: All six runs at Dundalk, scoring three times including a 1m4f rated race in February and a 2m handicap last month; dead-heated for second (with the useful San Andreas) behind talented stablemate Dallas Star over a trip short of his best on latest; has race fitness on his side and could make presence felt, though others are better suited by race conditions.

runners.name: San Salvador
runners.comment: Bumper winner and useful hurdler/chaser, won a weak Flat maiden at Dundalk in January
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner and useful hurdler/chaser (Grade 3 novice chase winner at Roscommon last autumn); won a weak maiden at Dundalk in January on first Flat start since 2022; in rear in a handicap chase at the Cheltenham Festival.

quotes.race: Ballymore Group Irish EBF Kilbegnet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: San Salvador is improving and was good at Listowel the other day. He's rated 135 over hurdles, and he's going to be something similar over fences. Just niggly things held him up, but he's getting a clean run at it now. Stalking away seems to suit him and he'll have no bother getting two and a half miles - JJ Slevin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Strings & Things Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: San Salvador jumped better. He has always had plenty of ability and got it all together today - Sean Corby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: tote.ie Never Beaten By SP Tara Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: San Salvador ran very well at Cork last time. The race worked out lovely for him today. He was able to get a lovely position, and apart from one mistake down the back he jumped very well through the race. He'll probably go up plenty for that, he might have to go up a bit to get into a race like the Coral Cup, but he will be going for another good pot somewhere in the spring - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: John J. Galvin Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward with San Salvador. He obviously won a bumper last time but it was a fair ask to win on his first run over hurdles ridden as positively as I was on him. I thought turning for home I was after overdoing it - and I probably did a bit - but in fairness to the horse, he didn't lie down and is hardy. He had good winter form last year, isn't slow and when he's in a good rhythm, he keeps going - JJ Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: San Salvador is quite a tall horse and still quite weak, but I thought he had every right to win that. He jumps very well so I would say he will go straight over hurdles - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well on his first start over fences at Limerick in May and will come back for a novice chase either next month or in the new year. He'll definitely be capable of plying his trade well in novice chases this season. 27-11-23

runners.name: Taipan
runners.comment: Enjoyed a profitable 2024 campaign, set stiff tasks towards the end of the season
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner, with three of those wins gained last season; best effort when beating the higher-rated Run For Oscar at level weights in a Galway conditions over this trip; also Listed placed last season; set stiff tasks towards the end of the campaign.

quotes.race: Rockshore Refreshingly Irish Race
quotes.quote: Taipan has been ready to run for about six weeks but the ground has come up quick, he just needs a little ease. He might have another go at the Cesarewitch and maybe the English one too - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Taipan is a gorgeous laid back horse and we gave him all the time in the world. I wasn't sure if today was his day, he never travelled at any stage but that's the way he is at home. He'll be a lovely staying horse for next year - Shane Foley, rider

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for a winners' of one race at Killarney next and we'll aim him at a premier handicap on Guineas weekend at the Curragh. The key to him is a little bit of ease in the ground, he doesn't need it quite as soft as he used to. 21-04-23

This beautiful son of Frankel was one we gave plenty of time to last season. He finally made his debut on November 1 at Naas, where he was drawn on the outside in stall 17 of 18. I told Shane [Foley] to let the race unfold and see what happened. He wasn't very quickly away and was mid-division but easily made his way through the field and went fourth with a furlong left to run, then once Shane asked him he ran on strongly to take the race. I was delighted with that effort as he justified the faith I've always had in him. This big, raw horse has really thrived physically since then. If all goes well the plan is to start him off in the Ballysax Stakes at Leopardstown over 1m2f next month and I'd say he'll get 1m4f in time. He's an exciting prospect. 17-03-21

runners.name: Falcon Eight
runners.owner: Dr R Lambe & Dr J Climax

prev_owners.owner: Dr R Lambe & Dr J Climax
Dr R Lambe & Dr J Climax

runners.comment: Smart stayer at his peak, fair form towards the end of last season, second-string here
runners.spotlight: Six-time Flat winner with career highlights in 2021 Chester Cup and a 2m Group 3 race at the Curragh in 2023; rated 110 at his peak, now down to 98; fair form towards the end of last season; well below best at Dundalk in January and over hurdles on latest; apparent second-string.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Loughbrown Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight is as tough as teak and was unlucky not to win the last two runnings of the Irish Cesarewitch. He deserved to win a race like this. He's been a cracking horse to train - Dermot Weld, trainer

quotes.race: Friends Of The Curragh Irish Cesarewitch (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight loves to come from off the pace and got a very good ride. He doesn't do things quickly and likes to warm his way into it. He's a grand stayer, a Chester Cup winner, but he just didn't get the run of the race for the second year running. Maybe he'll come back for a third time next year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: tote Always SP Or Better At The Curragh Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight was always going to get there from a furlong out and he won easily at the line. He'll probably go back over hurdles now after a break - Kris Weld, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight did it well. The ground was probably slower than ideal but he jumped well. We need to get more experience under his belt - Kris Weld, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: tote+ Chester Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: The plan was for Frankie to take his time. Falcon Eight had top weight and the ground wasn't ideal so patience was key. The reason Frankie likes riding my horses is because I love them to get into a rhythm and that suits Frankie. He waited until the horse handled the track and the ground and then said 'right, let's go.' The rest is history. The Ascot Stakes or the Queen Alexandra will be his next port of call now. We'll aim him at Royal Ascot. I have an eye on the Melbourne Cup for him later in the year too - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: JOC Metal Fabrication Limited Race
quotes.quote: He is learning how to be a racehorse and is still very immature and is far from the finished article. We hope he will make into a very nice four-year-old next year and we've had to be patient with him and it's paying off. He'll have one more run this year in six weeks' time. He won't be a St Leger horse this year but it would be lovely if he made into an Irish St Leger horse next year; it's a race dad has a good record in so it would be nice to add to it. We'll take baby steps for now and see where we end up - Kris Weld, assistant to Dermot Weld, trainer

quotes.race: Hanlon Concrete Maiden
quotes.quote: Falcon Eight has been a very late-maturing horse but I was certain he would run a nice race today. He is a colt with a lot of long term potential and today is only the start. He should be a very nice staying horse next year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The ground went against him in the race last year so that wasn't his true running. I thought he ran well in the Chester Cup last time given he had to carry 9st 12lb and Frankie thought he ran a very good race. 09-06-22

runners.name: Helvic Dream
runners.owner: Mrs Caroline Hendron & Mrs M Cahill
runners.comment: Group 1 winner in the Tattersalls Gold Cup in 2021, nothing like the force of old
runners.spotlight: Group 1 winner in the Tattersalls Gold Cup in 2021; best form last year was over hurdles, though he has failed to reach any heights in that sphere; tongue-tie may help, but nothing like the force of old.

quotes.race: Navan Ford & Opel Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I said the other day that if Helvic Dream was in a Group race on the Flat, I'd fancy him, because he was that well in himself. He's still novicey for anything big, so I would have thought we'll try and get another run into him somewhere and then tip along. He will go back on the Flat again this year - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote, Never Beaten by SP Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Helvic Dream enjoyed himself and did not do a lot in front but he won comfortably. He used to be very keen but he was very settled there in a messy race. He could be a Supreme Novice horse - Patrick Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Gold Cup (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Colin (Keane) said he was going to sit a bit closer and have one go at Broome. He felt he went too soon for Helvic Dream the last day and he felt he did again today. He has an electrifying turn of speed but lasted it out. It was a brilliant ride. He's been a pleasure to train and doesn't take a lot of work. There have been plenty of people interesting in buying him but thankfully the owners have kept faith in me as I felt he could win a Group 1 - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Novi IT Services International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I thought he was good all year but things just haven't gone right for him with one thing and another. I don't know where he will go next but there is the possibility we could travel with him. He'll stick to Stakes races now. He loves soft ground. He wouldn't want fast ground but I think he'll go on good ground - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Gavin [Ryan] gave him a lovely ride but he said it was very easy. They went a good gallop and he did exactly what he said he would. When he pulled him out he said he just had to change his hands and away he went. He loved the ground and quickened up well on it. Colin [Keane] loved this fella from the twice he rode him and Chris [Hayes] said last time he'd improve a lot because he was still green. The reason I claimed off him was because Dermot Weld was claiming 5lb off his runner and we would have been giving his filly 9lb as it was. I'd imagine we'll head to the final of the Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Series - Noel Meade, trainer of Helvic Dream

quotes.race: Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He hadn't been showing us much at all at home before he ran well on his first start and he got into a little bit of trouble at Galway. Colin [Keane] has loved him all the time - he was pretty confident that he was a pretty decent horse. I'd imagine he'll go for the final of this series and we'll probably give him another run before that. He's thriving all the time. I'd say the ground was an advantage to him. I felt that he mightn't be a real fast ground horse. I bought him off Joanna Morgan and she told me 'you have to buy him' - she was right. He hasn't got a great pedigree but he's a very good looking horse, big and strong - Noel Meade, trainer of Helvic Dream

runners.name: Jesse Evans
runners.comment: Versatile sort, ran only twice on the Flat last season but scored twice in 2023
runners.spotlight: Smart hurdler who has been notably versatile; ran only twice on the Flat last season but scored twice in 2023, including for this rider in a premier handicap over this trip at Killarney; won over fences at Galway last September and placed in a Grade 3 chase at Cork on November; first time with tongue-tie.

quotes.race: Galway City Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Jesse Evans was foot perfect the whole way round, indeed the mistake he made at Killarney is the only one he has ever made and it probably did him good. He is a good ground horse and my dream for him would be to come back next year for the Galway Plate - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Hotel Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jesse Evans is a nice horse and it was nice to see him quicken up the way he did. He likes goodish ground and we would have to think of a race like the Morgiana Hurdle for him now - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Flower Hill Maiden
quotes.quote: Jesse Evans did not do a lot when he got there, he would prefer a good gallop. He may well turn up in the Naas November Handicap - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Joe Bollard Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's now won his bumper and maiden hurdle so we'll give him a little time before he goes for something else. He jumps quick. I don't know how he will handle heavy ground but Sean said that was borderline quick enough for him. He'll go for a winners' race somewhere - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Kerry Petroleum Flat Race
quotes.quote: The horse travelled the whole way and picked up lovely; he is a smart horse and I was quite comfortable I would pass the leader and had plenty of horse under me - rider Mark O'Hare.

runners.name: Salt Bay
runners.comment: Uneven form for Ralph Beckett last season but holds a leading chance on his best form
runners.spotlight: Ex-Ralph Beckett; maiden winner on debut at three, 0-10 in stakes races; went close in Group 3 John Porter over 1m4f at Newbury last April and short-headed in 1m6f Listed race at York in June; however, his other runs last season were disappointing; moderate run over hurdles at Navan on stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's missed about four options already due to meetings being cancelled, including the Further Flight Stakes at Nottingham the other day. The ground is important to him - he needs it soft. Being gelded has helped him and he'll probably turn up in the John Porter Stakes at Newbury this month. I think he could get further in time. 15-04-24

It was great to get him. Alex Elliott and Valmont sent him over. Robbie Power had him for a month and he got him jumping really well and enjoying it. His schooling has been good and we hope to run him on Sunday at Navan, so we'll see. It's a long way to the Supreme but it was easier to have him in it than not. He's obviously a high-class horse on the Flat. 7-2-25

runners.name: War Rooms
runners.comment: Last season's Dante Stakes third, has been gelded, not certain to stay as far as this
runners.spotlight: Useful sort for Owen Burrows; campaigned exclusively in stakes races since debut win in a 7f novice event at Doncaster at two; best run last season when third in the Dante; failed to feature when tried over 1m4f in the King Edward VII Stakes; unplaced over 1m2f at Deauville in August; has been gelded; not sure to stay as far as this.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: That was what I expected at Sandown. We were disappointed there but nothing went to plan there and Jim was quick to say put a line through that. I was more favouring going to Newbury on Saturday but fair play to the owners, they were rewarded. The winner looks really smart but we were beaten not far by a Group 1 winner last year. War Rooms won't go to Epsom and we'll keep him for Royal Ascot for the Hampton Court. He's still learning and Jim said we might do more harm than good for the future if we were to go to Epsom - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Simon Piggott Memorial Race EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: War Rooms gave me a good feel. They went a strong pace on the ground and he stayed well. He'll have learnt plenty and has got a good mind on him. He's rangy and will be a lovely horse for next year. Over a mile and a quarter he'll be quite smart - Jim Crowley, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Romzina
runners.breeder: Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan Scea
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: Twice Listed-placed last season, relatively unexposed filly, capable of further progress
runners.spotlight: Won a middle-distance Cork maiden last August on debut; coped admirably in Listed company over 1m4f at Galway and Naas subsequently, third on both occasions; relatively unexposed filly, capable of further progress.

runners.name: Prestige Good
runners.comment: Posted his best local effort on his Class 4 debut latest; no surprise if he plays a role
runners.spotlight: Posted his best local effort when making the frame on his Class 4 debut last month; no surprise if he plays a role again today.

runners.name: Capital Legend
runners.comment: Landed his third local victory in October but has struggled off his revised mark since
runners.spotlight: Landed his third local victory when scoring over C&D in October but has struggled off his revised mark in six outings since; recent return to this grade was underwhelming.

runners.name: Highland Rahy
runners.owner: Peter Chu Ka Lok, Maria Teresa Chu & Dr C Chu Ping Wing
runners.comment: Made his local breakthrough with an all-the-way victory last month; 6lb rise asks for more
runners.spotlight: Made his local breakthrough with an all-the-way C&D victory last month; 6lb rise asks for more but he's on the up.

runners.name: Midori Fuji
runners.comment: Ran well when finishing fourth over C&D last time; still needs more to strike
runners.spotlight: Far from disgraced on his local debut and ran well when finishing fourth over C&D last time; still needs more improvement to get his head in front.

runners.name: Harmony Galaxy
runners.comment: Narrowly denied in December; has remained competitive and looks poised to get off the mark
runners.spotlight: Unlucky not to break his duck when narrowly denied over C&D in December; has remained competitive and looks poised to get off the mark.

runners.name: Celestial Harmony

prev_owners.owner: Lindsay Park Bloodstock & H M P Lam

runners.comment: Safely held in all six local starts to date; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Safely held in all six local starts to date; hard to recommend.

runners.name: Wah May Wai Wai
runners.comment: Runner-up in December but has failed to build on that effort since; should be showing more
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D in December but has failed to build on that effort since; should be showing more at this stage.

quotes.race: Frank Conroy Irish EBF Maiden
