quotes.quote: Juxtaposition is a nice horse, I thought he might be a little bit green tonight but to be fair to him when he got the chance he battled. His work at home had been good and he was just ready to run. I think he has a good future - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Joyous Lily
runners.breeder: M J Conroy, G & P Monteith
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in all three career starts; easily opposed.
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in all three career starts; easily opposed.

runners.name: To Infinity
runners.owner: Chan Wing Chiu & Yildiz Choi Yat Fan
runners.comment: Gained his fifth career victory on Boxing Day but has gone off the boil since
runners.spotlight: Gained his fifth career victory with a C&D success on Boxing Day but has gone off the boil since; revival required.

runners.name: Viva Chaleur

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Has shown glimpses of form on the dirt this season; not dismissed off a lowly mark
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden but has shown glimpses of form on the dirt this season; not dismissed off a lowly mark.

runners.name: Gallant Crown
runners.comment: 8yo who gained his seventh career victory in February; held off his revised mark last time
runners.spotlight: 8yo who gained his seventh career victory over 1m at Sha Tin on his penultimate outing; held off his revised mark last time.

runners.name: U S S Constitution
runners.comment: Yet to get seriously involved in 12 local starts; drop in grade looks imminent.
runners.spotlight: Yet to get seriously involved in 12 local starts; drop in grade looks imminent.

quotes.race: Ascot Iron Stand Membership British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We might look to throw  U S S CONSTITUTION in at the deep end next time. He's a lovely horse and I think he's the sort to be better when he's in a better class of race too - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Smiling Collector
runners.breeder: Mapperley Stud Ltd & Windsor Park S
runners.comment: Bit in-and-out this season but more than capable from his current mark
runners.spotlight: Bit in-and-out this season but ran well to make the frame over 1m at Sha Tin last time; more than capable from his current mark.

runners.name: Lucky Generations
runners.comment: Recent efforts have been underwhelming; now drops in grade and could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Shaped with promise earlier in the season but recent efforts have been underwhelming; now drops in grade and could have more to offer.

runners.name: Sweet Diamond
runners.comment: Won twice late last season but has failed to replicate that form in eight starts this term
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D late last season but has failed to replicate that form in eight outings this term; should be showing more off his current mark.

runners.name: Golden Darci
runners.breeder: M W Freeman & D G Price
runners.comment: Longstanding local maiden who's run respectably in six outings this season; considered
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden who's run respectably in six outings this season; one to consider now eased in grade.

runners.name: Island Golden
runners.comment: Snapped a losing run with a C&D win in November but form has dipped since
runners.spotlight: Snapped a losing run with a C&D win in November but form has dipped since; needs to bounce back to feature.

runners.name: Talents Supremo
runners.comment: On a long losing run but has threatened on several occasions this season; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but has threatened on several occasions this season; high on the shortlist if reproducing one of his better efforts.

runners.name: Ragnarr
runners.comment: Yet to win locally but has hinted at a breakthrough; caught late at Sha Tin last month
runners.spotlight: Yet to win locally but has hinted at a breakthrough; caught late when given a positive ride at Sha Tin last month.

runners.name: Ever Smart
runners.comment: Has made the frame multiple times this term; breakthrough victory looks on the horizon
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 12 starts but has made the frame multiple times this term; breakthrough victory looks on the horizon.

runners.name: Winning Heart
runners.comment: Unlucky not to score late last year; remains a contender if rebounding from a lesser run
runners.spotlight: Unlucky not to score late last year and remains a contender if rebounding from a lacklustre Sha Tin effort last time.

runners.name: Hoss
runners.comment: Displayed signs of life when second over C&D in February; chance if backing that up
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but displayed signs of life when second over C&D in February; chance if backing that up.

runners.name: Speedy Smartie
runners.breeder: Mrs V A & W K Pike
runners.owner: Dr Andrew Yu, Dr Alvin Yu Man Ho & Dr Bernice Yu Man Yan
runners.comment: Yet to add to an early career success but was unlucky not to score at Sha Tin last time
runners.spotlight: Yet to win since landing a success on his second career start but was unlucky not to score at Sha Tin last time; considered.

runners.name: Woodfire Champ
runners.comment: Broke his duck over C&D in October but hasn't fired since; not dismissed off current mark
runners.spotlight: Broke his duck over C&D in October but hasn't fired since; returns to his last winning mark, so not entirely dismissed.

runners.name: Wind Speeder

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Often goes close but struggles to convert; comes with risks attached
runners.spotlight: Sole local victory came in July 2022; often goes close but struggles to convert; comes with risks attached.

runners.name: Podium
runners.comment: Gained a deserved C&D success in November and has held his form well since
runners.spotlight: Gained a deserved C&D success in November and has held his form well since; respected if making the cut.

runners.name: Ho Ho Star
runners.owner: Simon Tam Ngak Chou, Tam Hin Chi & Ray Tam Fai Chi
runners.comment: Broke his maiden tag in January; held off his higher rating last month
runners.spotlight: Broke his maiden tag when scoring over 6f at Sha Tin on his penultimate outing; subsequently held off his higher rating last month so a step forward is needed.

runners.name: Money Catcher
runners.comment: On a 22-race losing sequence; down in class; unplaced in his last 14 attempts.
runners.spotlight: Triple Group Race winner who has not won for 27 months and has come down 28lb in the ratings since his last victory; this drop in class could prompt a revival; often makes the running.

runners.name: Senor Toba
runners.comment: Won off 32lb higher mark two years ago, winless since; little evidence of return to form.
runners.spotlight: Twice a Group 3 winner but no victories since February 2023; move to this trainer at the turn of the year brought a couple of slightly improved effort; disappointing two most recent performances.

runners.name: Mondial
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See

prev_trainers.trainer: M G Azzie & A A Azzie

prev_owners.owner: Trevelen Pillay, Kovilan Padayachee Et Al

runners.comment: High class in South Africa; has been unfancied and run moderately in both local starts.
runners.spotlight: Third in Group 1 company in his native South Africa; has run poorly at long odds on his first two Hong Kong outings; probably needs more time to settle in.

runners.name: Agenda
runners.owner: Albert Hung Chao Hong & Stephanie Hung Yujie

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant

runners.comment: Two modest local efforts thus far; yet to show the talent he did when trained in Ireland.
runners.spotlight: Group 3 runner-up when trained in Ireland by Aidan O'Brien; needs to take a big step forward on what he has showed in two Hong Kong starts to date.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Agenda had a lovely run last year at the Curragh in a race that worked out nicely and has the makings of a lovely horse - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We have a few possibles for the King Edward VII Stakes and this chap is one of them. He ran well in the Chester Vase and seems to have taken a nice jump forward from two to three.. 12-6-24

runners.name: Fallon
runners.comment: Going beyond 1m1f for the first time; in fine form and beat three of these last time out.
runners.spotlight: Not beaten by more than 3.5l in any of his ten starts this term but only one win (off 8lb lower mark over 1m1f here); good second last time and this longer trip could unlock further progress.

runners.name: Mega Force

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Yet to reproduce good European form in two local tries; step up from 1m/1m1f should help.
runners.spotlight: Second in 2yo Group 3 when named Gaspar de Lemos and trained by Aidan O'Brien; has disappointed on his two local runs (big odds both times); this step up in trip should suit.

quotes.race: Pat "The Duke" Leavy Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Gasper De Lemos had a lovely run first day and he will be very happy stepping up to 1m. He is a middle-distance horse for next year. He's more one for the Futurity than the Dewhurst - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden over 7f at the Curragh and finished second in the Zetland Stakes over 1m2f. He's done well and is working nicely at the moment. He'll step into a Derby trial on a nice bit of ground. 03-04-24

runners.name: Allcash
runners.comment: Has shown little and been dropped 16lb since arrival from Brazil; up from 1m.
runners.spotlight: Classy in Brazil but has never made the top eight or been less than 31-1 in the betting since arriving in Hong Kong; slightly better effort last time; step up in distance is a positive.

runners.name: Charity Gain
runners.owner: Ng Wing Shuen & Ng Wing Yin
runners.comment: In good form and 6lb better off for 1.5l course defeat by Fallon; lesser effort last time.
runners.spotlight: Highly consistent performer with two recent course victories to his name but posted a rare lesser effort when behind Fallon and Jumbo Legend last time; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Sharpen Bright
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; has been placed over slightly shorter the last twice; has solid claims.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer; has finished outside the top four just once (three wins) in his last 12 starts; still reasonably handicapped so another big run is likely here.

runners.name: Jumbo Legend
runners.comment: Likes this track but has never won at beyond 1m and is 6lb above his highest winning mark.
runners.spotlight: Four times successful at this track, all at 1m or less; fair fourth when upped to 1m1f last time but is going into the unknown here stamina-wise.

runners.name: Everstar
runners.owner: Jackie F C Hang, Colin L P Cheung & Fredrick F C Lun
runners.comment: Yet to manage a top seven finish in four attempts though not beaten far the last twice.
runners.spotlight: Has been unfancied and run accordingly on all four starts but has been beaten by less than 4l the last twice so might sneak a place.

runners.name: Swagger Bro
runners.comment: Much improved effort when C&D 1l third as a 24-1 chance last time; needs to back that up.
runners.spotlight: Reacted well to the application of blinkers to finish a career best 1l third over this C&D four weeks ago; fair claims off the same mark if the headgear works again.

runners.name: Giant Leap
runners.comment: Dual C&D scorer; only beaten by 2.25l when back down to this grade last time.
runners.spotlight: Dual front-running C&D winner who is back down to 1lb above his highest winning mark and went well for a long way when dropped back to Class 4 last time.

runners.name: Flying Wrote
runners.owner: Simon Tsang Heung Tung & Shirley Tsang Huang Yang
runners.comment: Returned to form when nabbed close home over this C&D last time; wide draw is a concern.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who likes to race prominently so wide draw is far from ideal; back to form after two poor efforts when caught close home two weeks ago, now 2lb higher.

runners.name: Happy Trio
runners.comment: Has suddenly burst back into form over his past two starts; looking for his fifth C&D win.
runners.spotlight: Ended a period in the wilderness with fourth C&D triumph in January, then backed that up with a neck defeat when last seen five weeks ago; now 1lb below his highest winning mark.

runners.name: Groovy Feeling
runners.owner: Dr Anthony W K Chow & Michael Tong Hing Yuen
runners.comment: Has run well on both appearances to date; may improve for the fitting of blinkers.
runners.spotlight: Has been absent for over ten weeks since again showing ability on his second career start (Sha Tin, 6f); application of blinkers could see him go close.

runners.name: Metal King
runners.comment: Half-brother to a multiple winner who has not shown much in four trial races.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a seven-time winner at up to 1m3f but has failed to make the top three in four trial races and will probably end up needing further than 6f.

runners.name: Nebraskan
runners.owner: Kenneth Lam Sze Ken, Timothy Junior Lam & T Fok Kwong Hang

prev_owners.owner: TFI Diamond Syndicate & Mrs L Fung

runners.comment: Got within 0.5l of a 16-1 C&D surprise last time; blinkers need to work again here.
runners.spotlight: Much the best of his ten turf runs (better on dirt) came when beaten by 0.5l in first-time blinkers over this C&D three weeks ago; unclear if that form can be trusted.

runners.name: Happy Shooter
runners.owner: 23/24 Danny Shum Chap Shing Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Nothing to shout about in four starts to date but jockey booking is very interesting.
runners.spotlight: Showed a glimmer of ability when only beaten by only 2.5l on his second start but his two subsequent outings have been less encouraging; booking of Purton catches the eye, however.

runners.name: Rewarding Twinkle
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Five modest efforts thus far but only beaten by 2.75l when denied clear passage last time.
runners.spotlight: Yet to make the top four in five career starts but he was denied a cleat run before being beaten by just under 3l over this C&D four weeks ago.

runners.name: Inno Century
runners.owner: Tsui Wo Pong, Dennis Lo Yuk Ming Et Al
runners.comment: Has run quite well in all three career starts; open to plenty of improvement; reserve.
runners.spotlight: His form figures do not look too flash but he has been beaten by 3.25l or less in all three career starts and has time on his side.

runners.name: Ka Ying Power
runners.owner: Wong Choi Ha & Leung Wai Chuk
runners.comment: 12-race maiden who had been running well prior to a disappointing C&D effort last time.
runners.spotlight: No better than third in 12 attempts but posted a string of fair efforts prior to disappointing 5.5l tenth last time; now 4lb lower than for that solitary placing.

runners.name: Cosmo Light
runners.comment: Little positive to say about his two runs to date; back from three months off; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Two very modest runs at huge odds so far; has been absent for almost three months since his latest try.

runners.name: Colourful Prince
runners.owner: Gary Gan Cheng Chuah & Gavin Gan Cheng Hooi
runners.comment: Ended last season with a good C&D third but absent for nine months since
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a close third over C&D but absent for nine months since and will need to resume in peak form to have any chance off current mark.

runners.name: Heroic Master
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co

prev_owners.owner: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co

runners.comment: Placed four times over C&D in Class 3 this season; major player in this lower grade
runners.spotlight: Without a win since October 2023 but placed four times over C&D in Class 3 this season and sure to appreciate today's ease in grade; reunited with Zac Purton; shortlisted, despite awkward draw.

runners.name: Sergeant Pepper
runners.comment: Quickly back in the doldrums here last month and can't be supported with any confidence
runners.spotlight: Put some disappointing efforts behind him when fifth over C&D in February but was quickly back in the doldrums when dropped to this grade for latest outing and can't be supported with any confidence at present.

runners.name: Happy United
runners.comment: Placed off 3lb higher over C&D in January but has very mixed record this season
runners.spotlight: Now 3lb lower than when placed over C&D in January but has very mixed record this season and is not an easy one to predict; refitted blinkers replace eyeshields.

runners.name: Thunder Prince
runners.owner: Wilson Chu Kwok Yiu, Paul M F Cheng Et Al
runners.comment: 0-6 in HK but ran quite well when dropped to this grade last month; not ruled out each-way
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo; unplaced all six Hong Kong starts but kept on for respectable sixth when dropped to this grade at Sha Tin last month and is another 2lb lower today; not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Alls Well
runners.breeder: Mrs H G & W G Bax
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Alan Leung Wai Zen
runners.comment: Came second in a recent C&D trial; now makes his official debut
runners.spotlight: May not be seen to best effect until tackling longer trips but came second in a recent C&D trial and evidently has ability; wears hood and tongue-tie for this official debut.

runners.name: Sunny Galaxy
runners.owner: James Chan Shiu On, Joseph Chan Ho Lim Et Al
runners.comment: Out of a four-time sprint winner; won C&D trial last month; of interest on official debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a four-time sprint winner; won a C&D trial last month and it will be very interesting to see how he fares on this official debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Plentiful
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner this season; has inside draw today and remains of strong interest
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 5 this season and took form to whole new level when powering clear for eased-down success in this grade in February; managed only fifth off new mark a fortnight ago but has the plum inside draw today and remains very much of interest.

runners.name: E Universe
runners.comment: Started off for new stable with two decent 6f runs last month; 5f not ideal; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Started off for Caspar Fownes with two very respectable fourths over 6f here last month but today's drop back to 5f is probably not ideal and he has the outside draw.

runners.name: Country Dancer
runners.comment: Did well to finish third from stall 11 over C&D last month but has same awkward draw today
runners.spotlight: Dual Class 5 winner this season (5f/6f) and in the frame three consecutive times since upped to this grade in January; did well to finish third from stall 11 a fortnight ago but has the same wide draw today and has been nudged up another 1lb.

runners.name: Crystal Powerful

prev_owners.owner: L K Fernie, K Doak Et Al

runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner in Class 5 last month but has more on his plate at this level
runners.spotlight: Capitalised upon dip into Class 5 when driven out for narrow C&D success three weeks ago; well drawn again today but combination of 6lb rise and quick return to Class 4 demands more from him.

runners.name: Decrelot
runners.owner: Hk Football Club Horse Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after five starts
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after five starts (6f-7f) and seemingly in need of a drop in grade.

runners.name: Parents Love
runners.owner: Edmund Ho Kwok Shing, Joe Fong Fu Yuen Et Al
runners.comment: In career-best form over C&D this year; will be respected if he gets a run today
runners.spotlight: Made all from stall 10 over C&D in January and finished second here on both subsequent outings; evidently in prime form; will need to be taken very seriously if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Bowser
runners.comment: In the frame on last three 6f starts; can feature if drop back to 5f suits
runners.spotlight: Raced exclusively over 6f this season, making the frame on his last three appearances; remains on a workable mark and can feature if today's drop back in trip suits.

runners.name: Viva Graciousness

prev_owners.owner: Bells & Phil Syndicate, Mrs V A Heathcote Et Al
Mrs A Borges, C L Lagerroth Et Al

runners.comment: Made all over C&D in November and has remained in good form since; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Made all over C&D in November and has remained in good form since; has awkward draw today but Zac Purton moves in for the ride; likely to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Foremost Teddy
runners.owner: Tse Ming Yee & Emily Tse Wing Man
runners.comment: Placed three times at start of season but has lost his way since; back from a break
runners.spotlight: Placed three consecutive times over C&D at start of this season but seems to have lost his way a bit since; needs 12-week break to have done him good.

runners.name: Happy Daily
runners.comment: Ran poorly at Sha Tin recently but was in good form over C&D beforehand
runners.spotlight: Needs to rebound quickly from a poor run at Sha Tin ten days ago but was in good form over C&D beforehand and has each-way claims at least if back on song.

runners.name: Smart Fighter
runners.comment: Ran well over 7f recently but he's drawn wide today and 1m may stretch him
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 6f here towards end of last year and posted another good effort when fifth over 7f at Sha Tin ten days ago but is yet fully to convince stamina-wise over 1m and has the outside draw today.

runners.name: Red Majesty
runners.breeder: S A G Coombe & Haunui Farm Lp
runners.owner: Pong Kin Yee, Samson Yip Yan Tion Et Al
runners.comment: Not getting any younger but is on a good mark and has the inside stall
runners.spotlight: Not getting any younger and was slightly disappointing here a fortnight ago but he's now 3lb lower than when fourth over C&D in February and, from the inside stall, he can't be ruled out.

runners.name: The Heir I
runners.comment: Ram okay at Sha Tin recently but is 0-17 in Hong Kong now and has become frustrating
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable fifth over 7f at Sha Tin recently and should be fine back at 1m but his strike-rate in Hong Kong is 0-17 and he has become rather frustrating.

runners.name: Top Time
runners.comment: 0-5 but kept on well for third over 7f last time and looks ready for a crack at 1m
runners.spotlight: A maiden after five starts but had to wait for room before keeping on well for third over 7f at Sha Tin in February and looks interesting on this first attempt at 1m.

runners.name: Amazing Award
runners.owner: Chan Kwok Yuen, Terence Lun Tin Yeu & Paul Li Cheuk Wai
runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner in January and two very respectable runs have followed
runners.spotlight: Driven out for narrow C&D win in January and both subsequent runs were perfectly respectable; needs to find something extra to overcome current mark but probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Gor Mo Tuen
runners.comment: Badly out of form this season, most recently on stable debut four weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Badly out of sort for David Hayes this season and there was no upturn on his recent stable debut; drawn wide today; very difficult to enthuse over at present.

runners.name: Santorini
runners.comment: Has cut little ice in 6f/7f handicaps this season; new trip and headgear today
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f novice race at the end of last season but has cut little ice in 6f/7f handicaps this term; moves up in trip and swaps blinkers for first-time visor today.

runners.name: Soaring Bronco
runners.breeder: Hallmark Stud Ltd & Trevor Hurley Trust
runners.owner: Simon Yung Yun Sang, Tang Ka Nin Et Al
runners.comment: Gained his recent win in lower-grade company but is evidently in very good nick
runners.spotlight: Won readily at Sha Tin when dropped to Class 5 last month; 6lb higher and quickly moves back up in grade today but is evidently in good nick; could have a say.

runners.name: Courier Magic
runners.comment: Placed over C&D on both starts for new stable this year and is still on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Placed over C&D on both starts for new stable this year and is still on a workable mark; well drawn today; shortlisted.

runners.name: Young Horizon
runners.comment: Well beaten over 6f recently and previous 1m attempts have not gone well
runners.spotlight: Placed over 6f here two starts ago but well beaten over that trip a fortnight ago and his previous attempts at 1m have not gone well.

runners.name: Dragon Four Seas
runners.owner: Dr Alan Lee Wai Kin, Dr Kelvin Chong Man Yuk Et Al
runners.comment: Made all for narrow C&D win last month; up 6lb and not quite so well drawn today
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive 4yo who doubled his tally for the season when making all for a narrow C&D win last month; not quite so well drawn today, though, and recent 6lb rise asks quite a lot of him.

runners.name: Motoman
runners.owner: The Hk Racehorse Owners Association Syndicate
runners.comment: Placed over C&D off today's mark on last three outings; wide draw dents appeal today
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly for ready C&D win in January and has been placed off today's mark over C&D three times since; wide draw dents his appeal today but he ought to give another good account.

runners.name: Prime Mortar
runners.comment: Not one to rely upon heavily but ran big race in defeat over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Not one to rely upon heavily but ran big race in defeat over C&D last month and can cope with a subsequent 2lb nudge if in the right mood again today.

runners.name: Happy Park
runners.comment: Opened account at Sha Tin in December but is yet to build upon that performance
runners.spotlight: Came good with narrow success at Sha Tin in December but has really built on that performance since; just a respectable fifth at Sha Tin last month (albeit denied clear run) and needs to raise his game here.

runners.name: Mega Bonus
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Tser Yiu Cho, J Tser Ka Ho & Johnson Tser Ka Yu
runners.comment: Front-runner; back in good form lately and has the plum inside draw again today
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who returned to form with a close third over C&D in February; slightly disappointing when only fifth from stall 1 here last month but has the plum draw again today and could be dangerous if all goes to plan.

runners.name: Star Brose
runners.owner: Peter Young Wai Po & David Young Yuk Chuen
runners.comment: Has tough draw for this official debut but the booking of Zac Purton catches the eye
runners.spotlight: Out of a 6.5f/1m1f winner; has not looked anything out of the ordinary in recent trials and has a tough draw for this official debut but the booking of Zac Purton catches the eye.

runners.name: Savvy Twinkle
runners.owner: Julian Hui Chun Hang & Michele Monique Reis
runners.comment: Showed significant ability on two of first three starts and probably still has potential
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth at Sha Tin (6f) on debut in January; disappointed on his next outing but significant positives can be drawn from last month's 5f run and he probably still has potential.

runners.name: Shotgun
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on debut on New Year's Day and has not raced again since
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify prominence in the betting when soundly beaten on debut at Sha Tin on New Year's Day and has not raced again since.

runners.name: New Power
runners.owner: Cheung Tin Chai, Cheung Shu Yan & Cheung Shu Tak
runners.comment: Consistent 4yo who was a very close third off today's mark over C&D two starts ago
runners.spotlight: Consistent 4yo who was a very close third off today's mark over C&D two starts ago; well drawn today and ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Accolade Start
runners.comment: Managed only ninth over C&D a fortnight ago and has now been unplaced all 15 HK starts
runners.spotlight: Managed only ninth over C&D a fortnight ago and has now been unplaced all 15 Hong Kong starts; favourable draw not enough to tempt.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Wahaaj has always shown us that ability and the thing about him is that he is a well-built horse and he is athletic. He does things nicely and he does things very well at home. He has really stepped up mentally and as a two-year-old you don't know how they're going to take to their second run. If he had run today and was getting stressed, then it would be a concern. However, he coped really well and it makes our planning for the future a lot easier - Patrick Owens, trainer.

runners.name: Fairy Horse
runners.comment: Placed twice in Class 5 this year but back up in grade and poorly drawn today
runners.spotlight: Placed in 6f Class 5 races on both outings this year but combination of wide draw and return to Class 4 leaves him looking vulnerable today.

runners.name: Shinkansen
runners.comment: Began season with string of good efforts but finished down the field the last twice
runners.spotlight: Began this season with a string of good efforts and is on a good mark now but has questions to answer after two down-the-field runs this year.

runners.name: Northern Fire Ball
runners.comment: Seemingly not suited by drop to 5f last month; contender if judged on earlier 6f form
runners.spotlight: Seemingly not suited by the drop to 5f a fortnight ago but was in good form over 6f beforehand and is not yet fully exposed.

runners.name: M Unicorn
runners.comment: Career-best form when emphatic C&D winner two weeks ago; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 6yo who posted a career-best performance when winning emphatically by 2l over C&D a fortnight ago; went up 8lb for that but still commands respect in current mood.

runners.name: Lovero
runners.comment: Awarded C&D race in November but has gone the wrong way since
runners.spotlight: Awarded C&D race in November but has not built on that performance since and was particularly disappointing here a fortnight ago.

runners.name: Hameron
runners.comment: C&D winner off much reduced mark in February but well held over 1m1f here since
runners.spotlight: Exploited some help from the handicapper when winning narrowly over C&D in February but last month's 1m1f run here was disappointing and some of his younger rivals have much more appealing profiles.

runners.name: Definitive

prev_owners.owner: M P Breslin, Ms T J Mercer & R W Potter

runners.comment: Rallied gamely for surprise C&D win in January and has made the frame on both starts since
runners.spotlight: Rallied gamely to cause 41-1 surprise over C&D in January, his fourth Hong Kong start, and has made the frame twice since (1m/1m2f); ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Lean Hero
runners.comment: Outran 58-1 odds when placed on belated seasonal debut and remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in very poor form but outran 58-1 odds when keeping-on third over C&D on belated reappearance outing in February; remains well handicapped and will be dangerous if that recent outing brought him on.

runners.name: Aestheticism
runners.comment: Yet to win this season but scores good marks for his consistency; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season but scores good marks for his consistency; beaten only by two necks when third over C&D last month and is reunited with Zac Purton today; one to consider.

runners.name: Chain Of Gold
runners.comment: Step back in right direction over 7f last month; still well treated on early-season form
runners.spotlight: Quite well handicapped on early-season form and took good step back in right direction when fourth over 7f here last month; drawn wide today but the return to 1m will suit; enters calculations.

runners.name: Ivy League

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Holds no secrets from the handicapper but is well drawn and has each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over C&D this season and arguably ran better than finishing position (fifth) suggests here last month; holds no secrets from the handicapper but is well drawn and has each-way claims.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Blackwater Handicap
quotes.quote: Ivy League did that nicely. He's a big strong colt and he's very babyish still, he will progress and is probably not too bad. I don't think he'll have any problem stepping into stakes company. He is not short of pace. He would love horses in front of him and a race like the Jersey Stakes could be a good option for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: A Americ Te Specso
runners.breeder: Go Racing Ltd & L J Shannon
runners.comment: Consistent sprinter; ran okay when upped to 1m last month but is not the percentage call
runners.spotlight: Consistent sprinter who usually finds the winning line coming too soon and has become rather frustrating; respectable fifth behind M Unicorn when upped to 1m here a fortnight ago but not the percentage call today.

runners.name: Mighty Commander

prev_owners.owner: A Boyd, P M Gangemi & Talinga Girls

runners.comment: C&D winner in January but needs to find extra to succeed in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with Class 4 C&D win in January; kept on well for creditable fifth in Class 3 at Sha Tin (7f) ten days ago but needs to find something extra to succeed in this grade.

runners.name: Devas Twelve
runners.comment: Dual 7f winner in Class 4 this season but has found things tough since upped to this grade
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner in Class 4 this season; also suited by 1m but has been unable to land a significant blow since upped to this grade for last four runs.

runners.name: Kaholo Angel
runners.owner: Ho Garrick Sai Man & Tam Wing Yee
runners.comment: Ran well over 7f last month and can cope with this drop back in trip; a possible
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice over 7f at Sha Tin in December/January and bounced back from a disappointing run when fifth over that C&D last month; can cope with this drop back to 6f and has a fighting chance.

runners.name: View Of The World
runners.comment: Very progressive 4yo; excused defeat from wide stall last time; remains of strong interest
runners.spotlight: Very progressive 4yo who has collected three wins this season (6f-7f); did not have the race run to suit when managing only eighth from a wide stall here in February and remains of strong interest.

runners.name: Beauty Infinity
runners.comment: Displayed good turn of foot inside final furlong here last month; 6lb rise not excessive
runners.spotlight: Largely in good form this season and displayed good turn of foot inside final furlong to score over C&D three weeks ago; well drawn today and recent 6lb rise does not look excessive.

runners.name: Romantic Son
runners.breeder: Hall Of Fame Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Opened HK account with narrow C&D win last month; wide draw a negative today
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in Hong Kong at sixth attempt, leading close home to prevail by a nose over C&D last month; could quite plausibly have more to offer but is poorly drawn today.

runners.name: Happy Fat Cat
runners.comment: Front-runner; held on well over C&D last month but looks shade vulnerable now 6lb higher
runners.spotlight: Fast-starting front-runner who held on well to score over C&D three weeks ago; drawn wider today, though, and recent 6lb rise leaves him looking a shade vulnerable.

runners.name: Nordic Dragon
runners.comment: Placed over C&D last month but this steadily regressive 6yo has not won since June 2023
runners.spotlight: Placed over C&D two starts ago and encountered some traffic when only sixth here last time but is not the force of old and remains without a win since June 2023; others preferred.

runners.name: King Of Fighters
runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who has been knocking loudly on the door in recent weeks
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian maiden who has finished second over C&D on the last two of his four Hong Kong starts; well drawn again today and features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Find My Love
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Dannis Lee Cheuk Yin
runners.comment: Won a shade cosily here last month but is quickly back up in grade and poorly drawn today
runners.spotlight: Ran on strongly to win a shade cosily over C&D when dropped to Class 4 three weeks ago; evidently in good nick but is quickly back up in grade today and has been dealt a duff hand draw-wise.

runners.name: King Miles
runners.owner: Bernie Yim Mei Fung & Yim Man Hay
runners.comment: Placed on New Year's Day but not in the same form since and has tough draw today
runners.spotlight: Placed off 8lb higher at Sha Tin on New Year's Day but has not been in the same form again since and makes very limited appeal from stall 12 in this competitive race.

runners.name: Tai Victory

prev_owners.owner: H H Ngan & P F Cheuk

runners.comment: Won on debut in Australia last June but made low-key Hong Kong debut over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Won 5f maiden handicap on debut in Australia last June but made low-key Hong Kong debut over C&D last month and might need a bit more time to acclimatise.

runners.name: Victory Sky
runners.comment: Close third over 7f two starts ago but held since and now 0-7 in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Hong Kong; suggested his turn might be near when close third over 7f at Sha Tin in February but last month's run over that C&D was a backward step and he may not have the early zip to make full use of his favourable draw over 6f.

runners.name: Written Casa

prev_owners.owner: Mrs L Lloyd, M H Wood Et Al

runners.comment: Cosy C&D winner in February but could not land a telling blow when back up to this grade
runners.spotlight: Displayed improvement to win cosily over C&D in Class 4 in February, his sixth Hong Kong start, but could not land a significant blow when back up to this grade three weeks ago.

runners.name: Run Run Smart
runners.comment: Ran quite well over C&D three weeks ago but has very mixed record this season
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable sixth over C&D three weeks ago but has a very mixed record this season and others in this line-up have more compelling profiles.
